7370071838258498858.voice_to_text: I made this recording 10 minutes I don't know if it's gonna take that long but this story is a rabbit hole and it made me believe in the paranormal forever my boyfriend and I had a spiritual attachment for nine months started about a year ago when we went to see his family in South Carolina and go to a cemetery we went with the siblings to play Find My Grave with a spirit box find my grave is basically like you ask a spirit box questions and see if the spirit like guides you to their grave basically gives you clues and whatever so we start doing this and all of a sudden we hear these music notes coming out of a spirit box that were going Da Duh Da Duh and that was kind of the spirits answer as yes you know so like we would say is your grave over here um it will go Da Duh were you a man Da Duh and then we were like wait were you a music teacher and it goes Da Duh so that was pretty crazy we walked all around the cemetery trying to find this spirit very active with us and then all of a sudden everything went silent for like 25 minutes so then we were kinda like okay whatever maybe this is BS so we started to nickname this guy Music Man throughout this whole thing so we at the end decided to leave and we were like okay bye Music Man and after 25 minutes of silence it goes Da Duh and we were like holy crap is this recording okay um so few days go by we go home I used to work in an art gallery which I believe was haunted so I turn on the spirit box I was alone in the art gallery and I was like is there anybody here ha ha whatever and the first thing that happens is Da Duh so I felt a little unsettled but I was like okay maybe there's something wrong with the Spirit Box like this is just all been BS like it's just like a malfunction in the Spirit Box or whatever till I go in another ghost investigation with a psychic that I trust and I go with my boyfriend turn on the spirit box starts going Da Duh the psychic goes I'm seeing six people in a cemetery going with a spirit box I'm seeing like a really old cemetery I'm seeing a lonely man I'm seeing a lost grave you have something with you and we were like whoa how did you know how many people were with us you're seeing a lost grave and she's like yes you have someone with you he really likes your energy he died alone yada yada yada and we're like oh god and so during this time this spirit box is going Da Duh okay fast forward to our next ghost investigation we are in Griffith Park and I have this on camera I will post it again so you can see so we're doing this investigation we hear the Da Duh Da Duh Da Duh over and over again and then finally the Spirit box says and I have this on camera music man he started to identify what we were calling him his nickname and I start crying I get really emotional and I'm like you know your name is Music Man how and then he finally speaks for the first time and he has this accent and he goes I'm proud of it over and over again I'm proud of it and he goes family and all this kind of stuff and it made us really emotional yeah okay so here's the next thing we do another ghost investigation okay the Da Duh Da Duh is happening he also likes doing opera he'll go huh huh so he's like adding other music but you know it's him at this point like you know it's him okay I I don't even really know how to describe it but anyways he starts to send us a message during this ghost investigation and I have this all on camera he says the No. 34 at least 25 to 30 times he keeps going 34 34 34 34 and we're like what are you trying to tell us we we and he doesn't he doesn't tell us what he's trying to say okay so then the next day I'm going on an Instagram live I also have this on camera and I turn on the spirit box and I'm telling my audience what was going on with the 34 thing and all of a sudden in front of everyone on the live he starts saying 34 34 34 so many people saw this happening and we're like what does this number mean what is going on I looked at plotlines at the cemetery we were at I looked at codes I looked at angel numbers and I looked at everything and and I still haven't found the real answer to what 34 was okay but this gets even better so just keep watching at this point I'm just using Music Man in my ghost investigations I'm like hey can you see if there's another spirit like can you bring them out and and whatever and can you protect us whatever okay this is when it gets crazy my boyfriend's looking for something for me for Christmas and I love the misfits they're like one of my favourite bands and he is at a vintage store and in the back of a rack is this shirt no context misfits font and it says Music Man and he got it for me for Christmas but it was weird why was that sitting in the back this lady said at the store that it's been there for a while no one knows where it came from or what it is I know there's like the musical Music Man but it didn't look like one of those theater musical shirts right okay I have it I'll I'll show it to you guys hey this is the shirt Music Man there's nothing no more information about it anywhere on the shirt it just says Music Man okay I go ghost investigating a store I hear that Da Duh and I'm like hey Music Man like whatever ha ha and he goes present in his voice in his like howdy voice I'm going like what like what are you trying to say and he goes Christmas present he literally said Christmas present he is such an intelligent spirit and I know you guys are gonna start saying like oh he's negative whatever but no he never was like he felt in a weird way like family and I'm not trying to like sound crazy this I got info about him for multiple psychics and they're like no he died alone and like everyone I've told this story to feels like he was left on earth for some reason to learn a lesson to figure out something to be a part of something he did he wasn't a part of in his life like he wanted to experience something and now I think we went to the Clown Motel and he was there with us I have it all on camera too on my YouTube and I'm like oh that's Music Man he's going whatever he's like very reactive and then all of a sudden after that investigation he's he's gone he hasn't talk to us since and we're trying to wonder why like what happened and like sometimes we joke we're like oh we miss him whatever and I mean obviously like no it's not good to like have an attachment around you all the time but we wonder why like what was the moment like why did he finally leave after nine months of just trying to send us messages and and being so responsive and being so aware of our lives like what lesson did he learn and and that's what I'm still trying to figure out 7370065592818076974.voice_to_text: So I have a story that I don't mind sharing um simply because it is the clearest God has ever spoken to me about anything okay so my ex and I we broke up around May—Mayish and we were pretty much no contact from May to August then in August we started talking again so one day we were talking he's like Uche you should come and see me he sends me the address and he's about five hours away and I was like Oof that's you know—that's a journey I'll still come…I'll still come but you know we're gonna have to plan this for a weekend where I can stay a little longer than just two three days like I wanna I want an extended weekend so we basically played it for like mid to late October and that was set  now from August to like  October when I left I was still single so I was still talking and like dating guys and on dating apps and so the very first sign I feel like God gave me was the night before I was supposed to go and see this man that was five hours away I went on a very promising date very promising showed up with flowers, we had great conversation um we went to a very nice winery like it was a very really nice date God was like here Uche here! please take this one and don't go and see that man that's five hours away and I was like nah nah God Imma still go see this man, I wanna see for myself anyway so the day comes for me to go  and I wake up super early, I put gas in my car I get on the road I start driving not even like an hour into this five hour journey right it starts to rain and I'm just like talking to God I think it's funny I’m like God I know I know I should not be going to go see this man but this will be the last time we're gonna talk and have closure it's gonna be fine like it's gonna it's gonna be good last time—I promise  I continue to drive and at the halfway point I think about two and a half hours in it starts to really pour it starts to really come down like I'm now going 30 or 40 on the interstate highway right put my hazards on, windshield wipers are maximum velocity and I still can't even see like 10 feet in front of me like it's raining that hard and again it's just me and God talking and I'm just like God I know you don't want me to go see this man but you can't stop me I thought that I was like YOU  CANT  STOP I'm going to go see this man I kid you not not even 15 minutes later my windshield wipers broke off both of them just broke off and fell by the wayside the saddest part about everything is that I pulled over cause I couldn't see couldn't see couldn't drive pulled over wait for the rain to clear once the rain cleared I picked up my phone punched in Autozone went to the nearest Autozone paid for new windshield wipers and continued on my journey to go see that man

7369954980402302215.voice_to_text: I just want to pop on here real quick to say what they're doing is extremely brave it is so brave and vulnerable to share such a personal experience and I commend them for that and I also wanna add my own experience to this discussion and the reason I want to do this to be very clear is because I feel especially with western attitudes there's this fear of making mistakes there's this fear of being seen as imperfect and yes I may be a scholar of languages and cultures but I wasn't always aware of my own biases and I think it is important to acknowledge that openly you know I didn't fall out of bed one day being aware about race inequality that was something I had to experience interact with witness a bunch of times and that's what I want to share that the first time I ever saw a black person TM as as they are in the movies right because Romania is white sadly and our people of colour are darker skinned but they're not dark all the way to the really really deep brown and I'm speaking purely in terms of colour shade right this is not about human value the first time I ever met a black person with a capital B was after I moved to New Zealand and after I moved to New Zealand there was a lot of new stuff to get up through my head those the new language the new weather the new culture the new way of doing things and then in my science class there's this black person and I've never seen somebody so dark and I'm 14 and I just remember feeling scared and then I remember going well that makes no sense why am I scared this person talks English like the rest of us and they're very polite to the teacher which is more than I can say for most of the Kiwi students so it doesn't make sense to me that I'm scared why am I scared so I was asking myself that and I figured I'm scared because I don't know anything about who they are what they like what country they're from and what they enjoy doing I have nothing to work with so when I don't know something I go and I look it up now of course you can't go and look up something about a person back in those days we had dial up right so after after class one day I run after them because I get they're very tall long legs and I just gather all my courage I muster all my courage and I look up to them and I go good morning and I come across a lot louder than I meant to because I was so nervous I was worried my voice wouldn't come out and long story short that was the beginning of a good friendship we still occasionally talk and when I was back in New Zealand we had a coffee and it was exactly like it had been when we were both in university so it's less that I discovered black people have real feelings TM because I already knew black people had real feelings I just didn't know how exactly the paradigm of Blackness fits within my understanding of the world right and that's not to depersonalise anybody to me people are always people and at the same time when I don't know much about a person I can't make up my mind what to do right so hilariously most of my friends in the first couple years of high school were um immigrant students and refugees and I I don't say this to to try and you know paint myself in a positive light or anything it's actually because they were the only people who had any sense of culture that I could relate to cause Kiwis were just not cultured that was the shock I wanted to talk about things yeah the the immigrant students were a lot better to talk to and that's how I learnt that we no longer refer to Iran as Persia because being a reader of a lot of historical fiction I knew of Iran as Persia and I had not clicked that there had been a few hundred years in the meantime again please forgive the grandma we did not have internet when I was growing up I did not know that it had changed names and it was now called Iran and it was no longer a kingdom I did not know that and so we had talks about this and you know how things changed and they actually I remember having this discussion where they told me you know in the 70s women in Iran were a lot more free than they are now and it's just confusing that you go forward in time but you somehow go backwards in terms of rights mind you again this is high school so it was a long time ago for me too TLDR your personal experience with people from different ethnic backgrounds is valid to you and it doesn't have to be perfect your experience with others is for you to learn and that doesn't mean that you need to let people being mistreated in front of you so that you can finally realise that they are people and they deserve respect no that's not what I'm saying I am saying to treat everybody with kindness and respect and whenever you find yourself thinking like oh these people will never blah because they're *insert ethnicity or nationality here* I just want you to pause I want you to pause and wonder have you met every person of that nationality or ethnicity in the world because unless you have there is no way you know everything about them and making mean judgements isn't helpful for anybody this is not to preach this is to remind people that we are all on our journey to learn more about our own humanity and the way we do that is by approaching people with kindness and sometimes that means not taking over dialogues and not sitting there and listening to people berate others because it's more comfortable for us I truly think that the only way for us as humanity to go forward is for people to come forward about their own experiences because the way in which your particular life has impacted the way you see others is so unique in every case and biases you my thing that biases are are things that just exist unchecked but there is a reason why people develop biases and that doesn't make them valid things that doesn't mean that they deserve to to mistreat others what that still means is they come for a reason and if if you for yourself can figure out what that reason is you can defeat that bias and that is the thing that will help all of us

7369693349411835178.voice_to_text: this video brought up some trauma for my past that I thought I had forgotten about but apparently just buried very deep and I feel like this is a good opportunity to share a story I started a new job this was roughly eight years ago maybe um maybe longer maybe like 10 years as a direct service provider for adults with disabilities and I had several of my new co workers that warned me about this one supervisor who really liked to pull people into her office and criticize what they were wearing um Mark them for not following a dress code um and it was a fairly basic dress code um I would I would compare it to similar similar as like like a high school um you know like no spaghetti straps um no shirts would like offensive sayings on it just common sense um so this supervisor wasn't my personal supervisor but she was a supervisor to half of the workers um out of this facility not my supervisor um so I really didn't have much contact with her um other than just occasionally being in the same building um she one day we were all meeting at the office and I had my client who so just to give you some context my client um was a large man who was supposed to be a two on one case meaning they're supposed to be two workers to his one person um just because he was very much a flight risk didn't understand you know dangers of like traffic and stuff like that um you couldn't just like say he hey hold on stay here for a minute I'm gonna run and use the bathroom and have him stay there um so just for safety reasons he was considered a two on one however I was the only person that was fully trained and I worked with him one on one every single day um and yeah so that's its own thing but anyways so here we are in a group setting in the office and um I'm gonna use her name her name is Jan she called me into her office and said she needed to talk to me and I was very conflicted cause I'm like here I am with my guy like I can't just be like hey just like hang out here while I go have a meeting right so I was like I'm I'm sorry if you need to talk to me you can talk to me out here because I can't leave my client like I'm not gonna just leave him out here unattended because that's obviously not safe um this got the attention of the whole office everyone was staring at us um and I had a couple people who were you know workers like me they came over and they said don't worry about it we'll watch your guy for like five minutes you go and have your quick meeting or whatever so I go into Jan's office and she shuts the office door and she goes behind her desk and she looks at me and she's like I just saw your butt I was like excuse me I don't know what you're talking about and she's like your shorts are way too short and I just saw your butt um and I know this isn't actually true I know she did not see my butt because I am very mindful and careful about the types of clothes that I wear just because like I am not comfortable to wear things like that that would show my butt um if that's what you wanna wear that's totally fine for you I'm just not comfortable wearing that on my body um so I was already a little bit upset that she felt like she was lying like why are you saying you just saw my butt like if you think my shorts are inappropriate that's a conversation we can have but for you to just lie and be like oh I just saw your butt when you didn't um so my guard was already up um going into the office her saying that and I was like okay um I don't believe you saw my butt because I told her that I pride myself on you know wearing fairly conservative clothing um and she's like well you need to go home and change and I was like okay well I said I can take my client home because his mom is home all day long um I will take him home I will go change and then I will come back and I turned around to open the door to the office to leave and she jumped in front of me like ripped the door out of my hand and slammed it shut in front of me and blocked my way out and she was like I wasn't done talking to you she like screamed right in my face and I was like at this point this is not a conversation I will not tolerate you yelling at me you brought to my attention that I was wearing something inappropriate and that I needed to leave to change and that is what I'm trying to do I'm trying to leave your office and now you're blocking me from getting out I said you need to move and let me get out of this office um and she again she's like I wasn't done talking to you and then at that point I don't even remember what she said I was ready to fight this woman um I did end up pushing her out of my way and I opened the door and I left um I took my client I brought him home and I was talking with his mom about what happened she kind of helped calm me down and she was like this woman is notorious for treating people that way she's like you need to report her and she was right I did need to report her it just took me a minute to calm down to realize what had actually happened um she was like you know you could even file a police report like she held you against your will in that office and she absolutely did like I had to fight her to get out of her office um I think I handled the situation very well considering the fact that I don't like to be somewhere that I can't get out of um I remained level headed she flew off the handle I don't know what her problem with me was I don't know why she was picking on me um but I did end up filing a report I reported it to my supervisor immediately and I then drafted an email to like the highest up in the company and icced everybody including her in the whole report I did like a whole report I did a letter um and honestly being around her was very difficult after that I felt not safe and I felt like she wasn't safe to have um clients around you know adults with disabilities that are could very easily be taken advantage of uh I did not feel like she was a safe person so we had a mandatory meeting where she had to apologize to me and I said I hear your apology but I don't accept it because it it wasn't an actual apology it was like oh you know like oh I got she never actually said I am sorry she like gave excuses and I was like yeah I don't accept that like thanks thanks but no no thank you um and ultimately she was invited to retire early so I didn't get her fired but I did get her invited to retire early and she worked there for like another year and then she retired and she was a bully an extreme bully and I was the first person that actually stood up to her and everyone that I worked with all my co workers were like oh my god like thank you for standing up to her like everyone was so scared of this woman like she was a bully um just some old white woman that's just like out here hating people like for no reason so don't know really what her issue was with me personally um cause I had never interacted with her before that so anyways yeah that's my story about angry old white women in the workplace

7369687551512251690.video_description: #stitch with @audacitii that was probably the worst butternut squash soup I ever made. if I find the house on Google I'll post it I've felt things more than seen em but this was too personal. could some the vibe be explained away a chemical leak or toxins on the property yep, but there's no explanation for the things moving around & other people on different properties next to it we're able to grow stuff on the land, there were a few sparse  little weeds  near the concrete but most of it was dirt and those Utah weeds get really tall. (I think they  mentioned that the owner wanted to seed lawn but it didn't take but it was all a long time ago) someone please check my other vids in the bus for dust particles could just be the lighting from the rainstorms they looked like dust to me, especially the second one but  yeah, I'm not necessarily a believer in these things but I'm not cynical either... I like to let stuff like this sit in maybe... this one tho was too much, I've experienced a lot but I never know for sure, the mind is a funny thing, I I don't wanna discount it's capabilities or discount the paranormal as it could just be stuff we don't have explanations for yet, tho I have a few ideas about these things & how they work.  some theorize poltergeists are stored up energy from a person who releases a lot of energy (some even use the term ectoplasm but I mostly just call it energy), sometimes that energy pools & sometimes that energy becomes a 'thoughtform' with the ability to move things but this (or these) thing(s) seemed more like a collection of energies with one or a few malicious ones.(the scariest presence felt masculine, there was also what felt like a child like or young presence) & it seemed like it was something that had been alive, not like something that was created, could have been a mixture of both but the folks who lived there didn't have this problem follow them.  some think poltergeists are extra dimensional, some think they are just unalive, some think there's possibility they can be any of these things and that u have to pinpoint which thing is going on. I wish we tried for a sand message I did tell em to try leaving an empty cup out  & then full but they didn't wanna. I ain't the best storyteller but I gotta get this stuff outta my head & tell folks so I don't forget what happened. #ghoststories #trueghoststory #spooky #priceutah  #haunted #scarystories  #haunting #ghosts #ghoststory #medium #scary #scarystory #storytime #scarystorytime #horror #ghosttok #scarytiktok  #hauntedtiktok #haints #hauntedhouse  #paranormal #paranormalinvestigator #ghosthunting #ghosthunter #ghosthuntersoftiktok #poltergeist #thoughtforms  #carboncountyutah #carboncounty #spookybasement #hauntedbasement #hauntedutah #iseedeadpeople  #paranormalinvestigation #sprites #ectoplasm  #orbscaughtoncamera #energy

7369389718087339310.voice_to_text: About this 27 year old woman that dropped all of her children off to CPS a week before mother. Okay, I'm gonna give my opinion about this whole story. If you haven't already heard about it, go ahead and watch the whole first video. This is coming from a mom who's had a child at a very, very young age. And also, I had a mother who did not raise me, and my grandmother raised me. But we are gonna start off with this whole situation. Is this horrible? Those poor kids are suffering no matter what. Like, I could not imagine already going through a horrible and stressful situation, uh, with your mother dropping off at CPS, but then having it also go viral on TikTok. And it's gonna be like, they're gonna grow up and they're gonna see all this, and already they're probably seeing so much about it. So I know she's mentally unfit, and she just pretty much just had a mental breakdown over all this. But still, I don't think she'll realize she did the right thing in a way. But also, if she were to, like, fix up her life and try and get her kids back, it is gonna be very hard. Now, I'm not saying she shouldn't get her kids back. I just think it's gonna take too much time to rebuild her relationship with her children and earn their trust back. Because when you still think about it, what she did, She could have done privately. She could have not done all those lives and all those videos. And then maybe I would see more potential of her possibly getting her children back. But right now or anytime soon, I don't think she should. It's still better though that she picked to drop them off, because I could imagine possibly what their home life was going to be like if she already was that overwhelmed, that mentally stressed out, and she just couldn't handle anything anymore. They see it matching the red walls and the red carpet. 7368929579957996846.video_description: #stitch with @Mama Jill after dark 👀 when someone tells you they’re struggling, believe & respect them 🩵 #weightloss #weightlossstruggle #bedrecovery #storytime #fyp #mentalhealthawareness
7368929579957996846.voice_to_text: what you used to post about your weight loss so now you can't just ask people to not comment on your body uh when I was at my lowest weight after losing 160 pounds I got down to like 135 ish pounds and I was getting so many compliments on my body people praising me being like oh my god you look amazing you look fantastic oh my gosh I'm so proud of you this is incredible meanwhile I was having to do very unhealthy things to maintain that lowest weight I was not eating enough I was exercising for like hours a day on top of exercising way too much during Monday I was trying to get between like 25 to 30,000 steps every single day the number on the scale absolutely controlled me and depending on what it said I was either gonna have a really good day or a really bad day thankfully I'm not there anymore and I've put on some much needed healthy weight and muscle and the thing is when I was struggling I was very quiet about it but someone like Mama Jill who has been very vocal that she is struggling and asks people to not comment on her weight or her body because she is telling you that she is struggling that should be respected because regardless of how you start out on a health or weight loss journey if you end up in a bad place and you don't want people to make it worse for you by commenting on your body and encouraging you to continue those behaviours then why would you wanna do that anyway

And my parents would buy us liquor, and we would sit there and drink. And sometimes my parents would be there watching us. Sometimes they would go out dancing themselves and just leave us girls at the house. Mind you, when my parents would leave, no guys could be there. Was just us girls. And for some reason, I guess we got bored, and somebody decided, hey, let's play with the Ouija board. So we started playing with the damn Ouija board. We set it up. We even turned off, like, the light. I remember. I believe I want to say I left the bathroom light on and, like, the light from, like, above the stove because we're in the living room, but that was it. And I want to say we even turned on, like, little candles. Okay, so here we are playing the damn Ouija board, and the damn thing is moving and it's going, and we're here blaming each other. You're moving it. No, bitch. You're moving it, bitch! I'm not moving it. It's you. Okay, well, finally, we were just like, okay, if there's really somebody here, like, prove it. Show us that there's somebody here. And I had the bright idea to get an empty beer can and put it on top of the trash can, leaning against, like, the wall, so if it fell, it would have to either fallen over to the side or into the trash can, right? So here, wherever. Like, come on, prove it, prove it, prove it. And the damn can of beer flew from, like, the top of the trash can to the other side of the, like, hit the damn wall in the kitchen. And we screamed, we jumped on the couch, and nobody wanted to move. Um, I think, like, couple minutes past, and we finally, like, all decided to, like, move together to turn on the lights and turn off the candles and just to get rid of the damn Ouija board. And we went to go check, like, if it really was the beer can, and it was the beer can. Like, we saw it on the floor and the other side of the kitchen, and, yeah, we sober it up. 7368618854433557803.voice_to_text: What's the most creepily intelligent thing your pet has ever done? So my sister's kitten knows that my sleep schedule is crazy and that I'm usually up all night, and he's found out how to knock on my door. When he wants attention, he'll start like smacking at the door to tell me he wants to be let in. The problem is, he used to meow when he did this to let me know it was him that was wanting to get in. And so obviously I'd open the door, give him his attention, then when he wanted back out, he'd go back to the door and meow at me to tell me to let him out. The problem is, lately he's found out how to mess with the doorknob. So instead of meowing and knocking so that I know it's him, he'll come to my door at three in the morning and start jiggling my doorknob. You know how fucking creepy it is to be awake at three in the morning just trying to watch some anime and your doorknob starts violently shaking? And he doesn't meow anymore, so I don't know whether it's him or not. Eventually it gets annoying though, and I open the door and he comes in. And then when he wants back out, he also hits the doorknob. So if I forget he's in my room, I just hear my doorknob being smacked from the inside. And it freaks me out even more cause He's tiny, so it's hard to see him over my bed, but then I'll see his paw reaching up and smacking the doorknob. So I'm like, oh, it's him! And then just open the door again. But it's like, creepily intelligent how he found out to hit the doorknobs instead of just banging on the door. Cause at this point I prefer him banging on the door and meowing as opposed to him smacking my doorknob in the middle of the night.

co workers are not your friends

7368505884156267822.voice_to_text: What's a piece of trauma that you have? That's funny. It has to, actually. My biological mother had 12 children total. Three of my siblings and I were adopted from Florida and raised in Arkansas. Our biological mother was not a good person. She indulged in a lot of bad activities and was not pleasant. Okay, little backstory. Her and her first born child did drugs, and she Od'd, and he did not. Yet a couple of years later, he did, though. So we have a memorial for our biological mother in Wisconsin shortly after she passed in 2020. And then we had a memorial for our brother, who passed away this past summer in Florida. Some of our biological siblings from Florida could not make it to our biological mother's memorial in Wisconsin, so we had some of her ashes to spread in Florida also. Okay, I'm gonna set the scene. So we're at the beach. It's sunset. It's so pretty. And my siblings and I, our family, we're all around. We're having a memorial and spreading ashes for our biological mother and our brother. We have flowers. We're going out in canoes, like, spreading ashes and, like, throwing flowers in. Some of our siblings that were around our biological mother and our brother more gave really heartfelt speeches. It was beautiful. So we're all just together, taking in the moment when all of a sudden, we hear sirens going down the beach, and there's police, like, going crazy. So it interrupts this little moment we're all having. So we're all standing there like, what's going on? And of course, it's Florida, so it's to be expected, you know, if you know. You know, in my head, I'm like, oh, a big criminal on the loose. Turns out it was a man trying to steal a honey bun from down the street in a convenience store. 7368300415252811050.voice_to_text: There are certain things that your employer cannot do. So I got a story time. So from 2005 to 2009, I worked at a place called Falcon Field, which is in Mesa, Arizona. For those of you not familiar with Mesa, Arizona, Falcon Field is a general aviation airport, meaning it's privately owned fix based operation, or FBO. And a lot of the things that fly out of there are private. Private jets, non commercial stuff. Military stuff too. Anyway, so I worked for a real winner, like I named Brandon. And this guy was real bottom of the barrel. He was real buddy buddy with the boss, but he was kind of a yes man. He was the manager of the feeling department, which I worked for. I did not get along with Brandon at all. He was a horrible boss, a horrible person in general. Short story about him, he used to get drunk and come into the field office at night and bug the overnight workers at like 2 or 3 in the morning. His being drunk was a severe problem. And it was so bad that he went to a bar and threatened to kill a guy that owed his boss money for working on his airplane. The guy he threatened, um, got him fired, um, but Paul, the owner of the Fix Space Operation, or FBO, um, only fired him to get this to blow over. I was extremely happy when he got fired because I knew I wouldn't have to deal with him anymore. And I was actually kind of friends with Paul. He was a tough ass guy, but a nice person, I guess, and I got along with him. So everything was going well with Brandon not being there anymore. And then one day he just kind of came in one day and said, I'm your boss again. And tough shit. So I was pretty depressed for a while. And it got really bad with Brandon. He used to call me the N word and the F slur all the time. And we actually almost got to do a physical altercation a couple times. And then one day I came in and I had not shaved to come to work, and I was fired for not shaving. I say all that to say this. Arizona is a right to work state as far as I know still, and you can pretty much be fired for any reason. And after being fired, I went to the Better Business Bureau, the Equal Opportunity employers, all these people, and try to file a lawsuit. Falcon Field went as far as to block me from receiving any unemployment that I had earned through them. After roughly a year of not getting unemployment and trying to file that, um, I got paid 52 plus weeks of back paid unemployment, which is awesome. But the point of the video is there's certain places that don't give a shit. About what they can fire you for and what they can't fire you for, because they know most employees aren't gonna wanna go through all the litigation. But anyway, do what you will with that information.

7367893991133662510.voice_to_text: so this story is only ridiculous because of the location this ghost story takes place at an art campus that used to be a tuberculosis hospital that is behind Casa Bonita yes this Casa Bonita this ghost story involves a murder unrequited love and a violin so sit down and buckle up first some history the Jewish Consumptives Relief Society was a tuberculosis hospital that was opened from 1912 to I think 1979 it then became a cancer research facility and then it became an art college I attended the art college and then worked at the art college so I was there for about five years and everybody had ghost stories on the campus and it's very reasonable there were so many people that passed away from the tuberculosis illness on that campus and the facility was open for a really long time so it definitely makes sense that the place is haunted as all get out one particular grizzly event however made state news and this is the particular ghost that I find the most interesting this is Isador or sometimes he would write his name as Isaac depending on the document that you look at and Isador was a child progeny at the violin he was very good and when he got tuberculosis it absolutely devastated him it ruined his career and he knew that there was going to be a huge chance that he was going to die and this was in the year 1920 so tuberculosis cures were nowhere near as good as they are now and he went to the only place that he thought that maybe he would have a chance that place was the Jcrs the jcrs was known for being the best tuberculosis treatment center in the United States at the time and he hoped that the Rocky Mountain Air and the facility would be able to cure him of his illness and it did to some extent the hospital provided such good care that he was able to go into remission several times during his treatment at the facility he was able to leave the facility and then when it got worse he would come back so all in all he had a pretty good chance that he was going to survive this is Bessie she's absolutely gorgeous and she was a nurse in World War One when she returned to the States she unfortunately contracted the Spanish flu which completely knocked her off of her feet and she sought treatment at the JCRs for a different type of illness so she sought treatment for that Spanish flu she was cured and then after she got done they asked her hey do you wanna work for us and she said I would be absolutely delighted within 10 months of her working at the jcrs she had already become the head nurse so Bessie and Isaac cross paths a lot because Bessie is treating Isaac's tuberculosis every time he comes back to the JCRs and he even says things like you know if it weren't for you I would be 💀 I wouldn't be here and she would always say things like you know it's my duty it's my duty as a nurse you know I'm trying to use the gifts that I have been given to make a difference in the lives of people he wanted to become romantically involved with his nurse she didn't think that that was professional Isaac proposed several times to Bessie she said no every time and he just really couldn't sit with no for an answer and it made him very desperate and very upset at some point in 1920 he was discharged from the hospital for what would be the last time they said you're gonna get better you're probably gonna be fine and he was a little devastated because he wanted Bessie to accept his proposal he wanted to be together and so he thought I'm gonna go buy a ring and if for whatever reason I end up back in this hospital I'm gonna propose one last time and we'll see if she'll take it he ended up having to go back to the JCRs because unfortunately his tuberculosis took a turn for the worse and it got really really bad this time like really bad like nothing he had ever seen he came back to the hospital and he did what he said he was gonna do he got down on one knee outside of the what is now the Rotunda building on the art campus and by a tree there's a very specific tree and he proposed and she said the same thing that she said every single time and that the answer was no and it was at that point that he pulled out a we4pon that he had brought onto the campus illegally they didn't know that he had it and he ended her life by discharging the 🔫 into her abdomen several times they were on a hospital campus so they tried to rush her to the emergency operating room to save her life and they couldn't she had probably 💀 instantaneously and that was it and unfortunately Isaac was never tried for the crime because he died of tuberculosis in the prison while he was being detained so the story is very tragic and a lot of the people who attend the school or spend enough time on campus often say that they can see Bessie they're wandering around the campus because she still wants to do her job she still wants to help people and so they'll say that they'll see a woman in a white nurse's uniform standing underneath that tree or walking around campus so she's very famous I don't think anybody ever sees Isaac I think he's moved on um but yeah that all happens behind Casa Bonita so take that as you will I have plenty of my own personal ghost stories from being on that campus so if anybody wants to hear it let me know in the comments and maybe I will make a follow up video about the spooky things that I have personally seen while working at the former Jcrs

7367870122150907182.voice_to_text: normalize posting why you broke up on the internet  if you've been following me for a while then you may have already seen this story time but it is way too chaotic for me not to hop on this trend so let's get into it going into the story I need you guys to know two things 1 my ex was legally blind without correction meaning if he wasn't wearing glasses he could not see and two we were sharing my car at the time and he was driving me to work in the mornings I worked at a hospital and my assigned parking spot was really far from the door and I had to walk through a lot of sketchy areas to actually get into my job so I just felt safer having him drive me when we first came up with this arrangement I thought it was a win win situation right I didn't have to worry about getting mugged on my way into work and then he would have the car throughout the day but where this arrangement became stressful was that I had to wake my ex up in the mornings he would not set alarms for himself and he would get mad at me if I woke him up too early or too late or if it was too cold so every morning I would get myself ready for work and then like 15 minutes before waking him up I would set a heater up in front of the bed and I would put clothes in the dryer for him so he had warm clothes to put on and then I would have to wake him up not so early that he would get pissed off at me for waking him up so early but not so late that he would feel rushed and looking back was I acting like this grown man's mother yes I was but I didn't see it that way at the time I just thought I was being a loving caring partner on the morning in question I have already done all of the things I've put his clothes in the dryer I set a heater up next to the bed and I go to wake him up at the designated time and when I go to wake him up I realise that his glasses are on the bed next to him and they are broken the best way I can describe this is a little screw had come out of his glasses right about here and so the lens frame had opened up and the lens had fallen out of the glasses completely and this is an oh f moment for me right because my ex needs these glasses to see to be able to drive me to work and also he couldn't wear contacts because when he was wearing contacts he would wear them for 30 60 90 days at a time without ever taking them out to the point where he f-ed up his eyes so much that putting in contacts was excruciating so glasses were his only option and because I was waking him up at the last possible second I didn't have time to drive myself to work park in my designated spot and walk 15 minutes to the door I needed him to drive me so I try to wake him up he doesn't budge I try to wake him up again a lot more frantically and I say babe I need you to wake up your glasses are broken when he hears this he shoots up in bed he grabs his glasses he's looking at them and he goes ugh I can't believe you broke my f-ing glasses Kirsten  and when he made this statement I had to take a step back and compose myself for a minute because bold of you to assume that I was the one that broke your glasses when they're on your side of the bed 7367838869309443371.voice_to_text: um genuine question for my K drama girlies out there have any you guys actually lived through like a like a K drama moment yes so I was studying abroad in Seoul South Korea in 2018 and when I was there I would often go out to the Han River by myself and just sit people watch watch all the buskers and vibe with myself and one of the nights I went out there I was just sitting and then I noticed maybe like five feet to my left there was this um Korean boy and he was probably similar aged as I was and I just noticed him I was like hmm wonder what he's doing he was just by himself he had a camera with him so he was like taking photos of the scenery and I was like should I make moves on him should I talk should I look over like what not but I was just in my own element um and then at one point of the night I noticed that he had gotten up and left I was like okay cool and 10 minutes later he comes back and he sits in the same spot and then 10 minutes after that he says something and for me I'm like was he talking to me so I turn over and he was and he's holding out this beer and he asked me if I want a beer I'm like oh sure so I receive it and he sits closer to me and we start talking and getting to know one another and it was just so very K drama esque uh we found out that we were similar we were the same age and in Korea it's a big thing cause when you're the same age as someone you're like oh my god friends chingu wow um and as we were talking as we were vibing looking out at the view there were people literally right in front of us playing with fireworks over the river so in that moment I was like wow this is such a K drama moment sitting having such a meet meet cute with this Korean man that offered me beer looking out at the water and the nightscape with fireworks out front that was it that's my K drama story and we went for one date after that and he was like whatever but yeah that's just a story that sticks in my mind

7367823846671387950.voice_to_text: Tell me a ghost story that sounds completely unbelievable but is entirely true. I'll go first. 10 foot tall shadow figures, creaking floors, lights that turn on and off. Civil War trenches in your backyard. Welcome to my ghost story. So I never thought I would have an actual ghost story, but I do. I live in a 1957 brick ranch house. Um, and it kind of has a weird vibe to it a little, but I've personally never seen anything. I've experienced a couple things, but I've never actually seen a ghost. When I got the house, I knew that someone had died in it, and I didn't really think that was unusual or scary, because people die at home all the time. And this was an elderly gentleman that had cancer. He was very sick, and he passed away at home. So it wasn't like a violent death or anything like that. But there have been some things since I've lived here that were kind of odd. Like, I have seen the light in my closet turn off and on by itself. Um, but I kind of figured, oh, you know, maybe the light bulbs loose or it's old wiring. My youngest daughter is the one that has had the most experiences. She has heard a man's voice in her bedroom, whispering to her. Um, in the backyard, where we think there's Civil War fortifications, she has felt like someone or something blowing in her ear, uh, when There was no wind, no bugs, nothing like that. Um, the most recent thing, about a week ago, she saw a shadow figure that she describes as being, like, 10 feet tall, that it was so tall it had to bend across the ceiling. And it was just, like, standing in a corner of a room, watching her from the corner. And then it started pacing back and forth, and it moved in front of a fan she had on her floor that was on. And she said it completely, like, block the air from the fan. Like, she couldn't feel it anymore. Um, and it scared her to death, obviously. She came in my room crying her eyes out. Um, after that, she did end up going back to bed, but with the light on. And I personally, for the next, like, 30, 40 minutes after she went back to sleep, heard something walking across the floor. So my floors are hardwood, and they're older, so when you walk on them, they creek. They squeak. Like, you can audibly hear it. And that's what I heard that night. Like, something like walking and pacing back and forth on the floors. And I got. Got up and nothing. I didn't see anything. My daughter wasn't awake, the pets weren't awake. Nothing was moving. So I don't know what to think. But there is something going on, and we could sure use some help. If you can tell me what. I Should do to get rid of whatever it is. Please tell me

7367731664409365806.voice_to_text: okay so I'm gonna try to figure out how to say this in a way hey guys it's DOC Bradley please go back and watch that entire clip from that content creator she's always on point and this one in particular she's talking about Black Women's Day of meditation and um this is such an important topic in terms of taking time to focus on self care taking time to implement practices that honor your body and your mind and for me um meditation and yoga has been critical in terms of um my overall health I was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis over a decade ago and um even prior to that uh when I was pregnant I had a significant amount of nausea I lost a lot of weight and implementing my um gynecologist excuse me my obstetrician implemented meditation as part of my treatment strategy and that really laid the groundwork for me incorporating yoga and meditation into my health practices and it's been life altering in terms of helping to manage my um diagnosis so please take a look at that clip um whether you're a black woman or you just want to uh participate in this event it's May 11th this coming Saturday it's just a day of meditation and care so take a look at that clip make sure you guys are taking care of yourselves and I'll see you guys for the next post peace

through my belongings like my personal belongings her touching me and grabbing me and then the final straw for me was when she told a co worker a joke where I was in an accident I got hit by a car walking across the street on company time and she told another co worker a joke about it roughly a year after the accident um and basically the joke was that I was probably jaywalking I deserve to get hit by the car of course this was an older white woman making these jokes and engaging in this pattern of behavior over the course of this pattern of behavior happening I made four formal complaints, 2 to supervisors and 2 to the person that the supervisors directed me to which was HR this escalation of actions took place over the course of about three years two and a half years um and I spent so much time convincing myself that I was the problem and I was freaking insane before I finally realized no amount of me being involved doing the formal reporting doing everything they were telling me to was actually going to solve the flippin problem it absolutely broke my heart because when I first started that job I really thought it was gonna be my dream job I was gonna be there for a long time there were many times where I had issues with older white women who I was working with normally they were a manager and I was always told by other managers other people in positions of power same as I was told with this woman that oh they're jealous of your youth they're jealous of your power they're jealous of your you know potential and like that is such a weird way to excuse this honestly inhumane and cruel behavior but like regardless really wish somebody would have prepared me for it would have made my life a lot easier the last two and a half years and would have helped me feel less insane while I was dealing with it like if I would have known that like this is a thing other people experience I probably would have been less quick to gaslight myself about the reality of the situation all this to say it did end up in the best possible way to be honest I ended up quitting the job about like 5 months ago with no backup plan outside of like a few months worth of savings from up for jobs that I never thought that I would even be qualified for and they pay way more than the last job and they're way less stressful um so yeah all that to say uh this sucks it's unfortunate happen

7367400195862039850.video_description: #stitch with @Walter Masterson how living with Bedouins made me understand the cost of occupation and apartheid. #gaza #storytime #freepalestine #🍉
7367400195862039850.voice_to_text: as a traditional egalitarian American Jew it is always really reassuring to see moments and takes like this from other Jews because it can be so isolating in this world to have ambiguous or not perfect love and adoration of the state of Israel and what really changed for me and how I got here was the fact that in 2011 after college I did economic development with Bedouins in southern Israel I was about 10 minutes outside of beersheva I was within the 67 border and I just saw first hand how dehumanizing the occu Pa tion is and how horrific it has been for people even those that are considered Israeli citizens um and so in this Bedouin town called Lachia uh I was there and everybody had water tanks that I thought was kind of weird until I realized sometimes the water just goes out sometimes you're mid shower and you're just shit out of luck and this is the desert like water you can't just like run to a spring right there's just not a river to go to I Learned that a lot of what the organisation as part of was doing was literacy because for decades like literally after the founding of Israel there were no schools close by for Bedouins and traditionally Bedouins the men would go and roam with the herds and the woman would stay near the house and do a lot of the farming and so men would go to school because that felt kind of akin to what they did previously but it was a lot harder they didn't feel comfortable sending their women and so there's like whole generations of women that are illiterate and they're having to do a lot of catch up because the state wasn't bringing schooling close and affordably to them there's also a lot of ancestral claims of land in the desert by Bedouins and because those claims aren't recognised when people build houses they're considered like unrecognised and the state will come and demolish them they won't provide any services and they will come and raze their homes to the ground um this was happening all over the south while I was there um and it's really traumatizing to watch that oh and on top of that like I would travel around Israel like I had weekends off I had holidays the number of like terrible things that people felt comfortable saying to me was astonishing they were like why are you working with better ones when you can work with Jews they would you know talk about just how more like animalistic Arabs are um it was baffling to me and incredibly insulting because these people had like taken me into their homes they had welcomed me they had been very very kind to me and like it was just so wild to be watching Jewish Israelis like spout this nonsense that like people used to say about us all over like the irony was not lost on me and the thing is that most American Jews do not get ever get an experience like I did they might go a little bit into like parts of Jerusalem but they're not spending time really in depth of Palestinians they're not having conversations they're not building relationships and that's on purpose that's that's on purpose um so they're only seeing one side of it they're only getting one narrative and it has been so built up that this state is so key for our safety that it's the sort of us versus them thing that like if they have a chance they're going to wipe us from the face of the earth like all of this has been so built up that I think even now even now when you see some of the most horrific things happening in Gaza like people are still you know doing what about October 7th what about the hostages what about this like two wrongs don't make a right and it's deeply deeply hurts me as somebody that like believes that my Judaism is about showing up well in this world like my practice is about both connecting to the divine but also like connecting to the earth connecting to people and like what we leave behind matters and like this state all of those things is is now my Judaism and for community that often relishes discussion relishes debate and has such a welcoming kind of large tent perspective the radical hard lines that I'm seeing within Jewish spaces around this topic like it's not often safe to even have just to be able to say like I have an ambivalent relationship to Israel like I don't see it as my homeland or I like even just having some critical discussions of what the state is doing is considered radical and like that's not it shouldn't be like this and my hope is that we're finally getting to this moment where we can really start reclaiming that like Judaism does not equal Zionism they're two different ideologies there's lots of people that have an overlap but that doesn't mean if you criticize Zionism you criticize Judaism one is not the other these are apples and oranges for God's sake and for 2,000 years we have been living all over the world and as an American Jew and as a Jew of the diaspora that's the Judaism that I have really fallen in love with is this idea of what does it mean to have a relationship with god my people my faith no matter where I am um and one of my favorite prayers is the kedusha which is about how God's holiness is everywhere and bless the place of god and I think about that a lot which is we do have a lot of liturgy around Jerusalem around Zion but what I really think about is how do we bring the divine in here and now and what does that look like and it does not look like what the Israeli state is doing in Rafa it does not look like what's happening in Gaza

because the story that he tells reminds me of my best friend so I have known my best friend since we were 11 years old so obviously when we get to drinking age we start going out together now another thing about what he said is not just finding out that your friends can't handle their liquor it's also having to find out what types of drunks your friends are so for example you know some people are like angry drunks some people um drink and they get really excited happy like to dance some people drink and they get emotional well my best friend drinks and she likes to run away so now that we're in our 30s I don't chase after her I know this about her um she pretty much comes back at this point but when we first started drinking it was different like she would just disappear she wouldn't tell anybody she was leaving you would just look up and she would be gone and again this is when we first start drinking so me I'm freaking out and I'm always chasing after her so this one specific night her boyfriend or maybe was her fiance at the time they're married now um couldn't come with us so he was like Krissy I'm trusting you to keep her safe and get her home to me and I was like no problem I got this and I don't know if I fully understood her level of runaway at this point or if I just was like overconfident but I was convinced that I wouldn't have an issue maybe I thought because her boyfriend wasn't there she would stick with us but I was wrong this girl got drunk and she did her normal runaway thing so we have went to this place called Power Plant right and if you haven't been to Baltimore before it's like this outdoor area and then like five or six probably more back then yeah bars that you could go into but like you have to show your car to get in the general area and then you can go to whatever bar you wanna go to so we had this bar we always frequented called Mex we really didn't go around to other bars occasionally we did but generally we were at Mex so we're there dancing having a good time we look around she's gone so my first thought is okay she has to be in one of the other bars right so we all kind of like leave out a mix and go to the other bars we can't find her anywhere and my boyfriend at the time he's like freaking out like he's like what if something happened to her or like what if she's not okay like he's going off the deep end so much so that like he's drinking but not eating and he ends up getting sick so it's chaos like we're all just looking around we're not even having fun anymore we're just trying to find her because I'm like oh my gosh I have to get her cause I'm drinking too so all I could think about is oh my gosh I told her boyfriend that I would have her home and I don't know where she is and all of this so we are calling her phone we're like canvassing the area basically and we can't find her so at some point I think I get a hold of her and she tells us like where she is and we go over there and she's not playing games and she's drunk so at some point I call him y'all why does he answer and say oh she just walked in the door this girl caught the bus home and we always caught a taxi I must say Uber but tells me that she needed to take a walk and she went over to Baltimore Street which again if you're not from Baltimore that is where our strip clubs are she went over to the strip clubs then she left from over there and she apparently went to get some food like went out to eat and then she decided to catch the bus home this is the kind of shenanigans I have to deal with with her again we're in our mid thirties now so like I don't do that anymore and also like she comes back like it's not that big of a deal anymore but at that time and like early 20s it was definitely a big deal now like she'll Adventures and Ghost Hunters all the TV shows you know the deal May 23rd, 2014 I went on my first ever ghost hunt at the parks Bentley House in South Glens falls New York or Moreau New York I was hooked instantly it was a great time and ever since then I've been ghost hunting pretty consistently over the past year and a half two years or so we started YouTube uh we've started doing you know TikTok and Instagram a lot more and I've been able to go full time on social media which is absolutely insane had the opportunity to be on Destination Fear had the opportunity to work with a ton of awesome creators uh it's been a wild ride but anyway without YouTube we would not have even caught this would not have thought about it a second time but YouTube has allowed us to document all these things that have happened so we do public ghost hunting events we were down in West Virginia at a place called the Old Hospital on College Hill doing a live stream we were filming down there and the next day we had events we were walking around it was broad daylight with some of our friends and we did an EVP in one of the rooms and we got this name Christopher we're like oh maybe he was a patient maybe he was one of the nurses here one of the doctors that's kinda cool we got a really clear name Christopher the following day we went down to Felicity Ohio to the Broadwell Funeral Home and it was built by a guy named Christopher Broadwell and he was the one who operated the funeral home to start with so to begin with we didn't really put two and two together we're like oh that's kinda weird we got Christopher you know the other day and then we got Christopher here he was the one who built the house I wonder if there's any connection while investigating that home we got the name Christopher Broadwell and we're like okay that's kinda weird the way he said Christopher sounded almost exactly like the you know the EVP that we got at Old Hospital on College Hill in West Virginia but why would he be in West Virginia you know we didn't have plans to go to the Broadwell Funeral Home prior it was just kinda like a whim thing we're already on the road might as well film right then over the next like seven to eight months we get the name Christopher Broadwell on every single paranormal investigation that we went on whether we were filming whether we were just hanging out with friends it did not make any sense because first of all we didn't start out at the Broadwell Funeral Home so how did he know we were in West Virginia second why would he follow us that's so random everywhere everywhere we went but then when we went to Canada we did not get his name so maybe he doesn't have passport so we didn't really believe in attachments before this but we definitely figured that he It comes to us from plenty the younger, who lived between about 50 and 116 AD, so nearly 2,000 years ago. And it came to him from his freedmen, or freed slave, Marcus. Now, Marcus, as the story goes, had a brother. Now, one day when they were sleeping next to each other, as slaves tended to do, his brother was struggling to fall asleep. Now, he looked over and he saw in front of him a figure sitting on the bed, looking at him. And to his horror, when he looked down, he saw that this figure had shears in his hand. This figure rose from the bed, walked towards him, picked up his brother's hair and cut the hair. Now, somehow, I don't know how, Marcus's brother eventually fell asleep. And in the morning, he woke up and he thought, wacky dream. But when he looked down, he saw that his hair was all over the floor. Now, Marcus told this to Pliny, who thought, yep, that is pretty weird. And he thought nothing of it until somebody else came to him with a very similar story. This time, it was one of his slaves. Now, this slave was sleeping in the slave quarters, so he was surrounded by other slaves who probably sleeping on mattresses on the floor, or maybe beds if they were Lucky. So the slave was again struggling to fall asleep. And he saw two figures dressed in white enter the room through the window. And guess what they had in their hands? She is one of them. Turns towards the slave, walks towards him, picks up his hair and cuts it. The figures then move back and walk out the way that they came through the windows. And when he woke up in the morning, he thought, weird dream. But he looked down, and to his horror, his hair, chopped from his head, was spread all over the room. Now, he told plenty this, and plenty then told a Roman senator. So what I feel like is really spooky about this. Is that plenty clearly thought that there was some truth to this. 7366402283346742570.video_description: #stitch with @audacitii  And before anyone asks, no I didn’t live near the Appalachian Mountains. I lived in New Jersey. But anyways, I have tons of stories from growing up in a haunted house but this one was always the strangest. Maybe not the craziest thing in the world but it was crazy to me and it still freaks me out to this day 💀 Let me know if you want to hear more 😅 Also sorry if I kept looking off camera. I was reading off some notes I made about my experience since I struggle to speak unscripted on camera 😭 🏷 #ghost #ghoststory #ghosttok #paranormal #paranormaltiktok #paranormalactivity #storytime #hauntedhouse #truestory #creepy #spooky #scary #scarystory #childhoodmemories #audacitii #audacitiisitch #fyp #fy #foryoupage

7366367208278084906.voice_to_text: So, I tried stitching this quite a few different times- I even tried just saving the video and cutting it and then adding my stuff to the end of it… didn't work! Don’t know what's going on with that! So, I'm gonna try this one. I lived in the same house my entire life up until September of last year, and I now live with my cousin for the time being, so I have plenty of stories to tell… but I think I'm gonna tell the one that sticks with me the most.  Um… I was in elementary school when this happened. My dad worked at this place that had frequent stray animals, and this was no different. Um… one night he brought home a dog that we named Bear, because he was covered in soot and he looked like a little bear. Um… he was extremely old, he was blind in one eye, completely deaf, he walked with a limp, he was just really not in good shape and we didn't think he would live that long… so… Dad brought him home and decided he could live with us for the rest of his life, for however long that may be, and we had him maybe three or four months before he did eventually pass away. So the story really starts a couple months after he died. One morning my parents and I were getting ready to go to church, and I had this little clipboard that I would write Bible verses on as my preacher would talk about them, and we were all ready and in the car and about to go and I remembered that I had forgotten it upstairs, so my mom gave me the house key and let me go back inside by myself, which I hated every second of because I hated being in the house by myself… and another thing, I need to explain the upstairs interior just a little bit. So you have the staircase, and then at the top of the staircase directly in front of the landing is my room, and then if you're at the top of the landing and you turn right, there's a hallway that connects to my brother's room, and in that hallway there's a closet. So now that that's out of the way, as I was leaving my room, at the bottom of the stairs there was this decently sized orb of light that came up, it went down the hall, and then it went into the closet and just kind of hovered in the doorway of the closet… and it was about the height of where Bear's head would have been if he was standing right there. And I just wanna say that I wasn't scared of this, I didn't feel anything evil from it, I didn't feel anything really… but I just couldn't help but feel like it it was Bear, like he was there, he was checking on me saying “hi! how are you?” and that was that. And I've told plenty of people about this, but most people don't believe me, and simply for the fact that most people don't think that animals have souls… and that nothing really happens to them once they pass over, but I I like to think that it was him. :)

7366355788182474026.voice_to_text: I feel people are gonna think I'm crazy, but I have to tell this ghost story. So after my mom passed away, we were thinking about moving. So my dad told me that I should probably clean out her music studio where we used to play music together. Um, maybe take some pictures of it and solve some of the instruments in there. I'm like, okay, that sounds like a good idea. So I go out there one night and I'm looking around, and I find this CD for this band called Sunset Curve. And I never seen it before, and I never heard of them. So I was like, maybe I should listen to it while I'm cleaning. So I put it in and I press play, and music is pretty good. But then all of a sudden, I start hearing the screaming. And it's not coming from the CD, it's coming from the room that I'm in. And all of a sudden, these three boys just appear in my mom's studio. So I start screaming, and then they start screaming, and I just book it out of there, cause, like, I'm not trying to get haunted or whatever. And I passed my dad and my brother, and they don't believe me that there's ghosts in my mom's studio. So I'm just like, what is going on? What is happening? So take a moment to calm myself in my room before going back out there. And I grab a Little cross. Cause, like, they're ghosts and I need to protect myself. I don't know what they're capable of. And I go back and I'm looking around and I don't see them, but, like, I know I saw something. Like, I'm not crazy, right? And all the sudden I hear this voice behind me go, well, we're all a little crazy, right? I turn around and the boys are back. So I'm screaming again, but I managed to calm down and I'm talking to them. And it's weird because they're really cute. But there's no such thing as cute ghosts, right? And it turns out they're a band from the 90s called Sunset Curve. And they died in 1995 from eating bad hot dogs. And nobody else can see them. My brother came in, he couldn't see them, my dad came in and he couldn't see them. But they can hear them when they play. So I'm thinking of starting a band with them and calling it Julie and the Phantoms.

7366304199056887072.voice_to_text: For forever. But when two people get married, they should take the cooler last name. So my husband took my last name. It's not necessarily the cooler of our two last names, but it did cause a lot of anger, frustration, upset. I don't know what you wanna call it. So, um, it wasn't that I wouldn't take his last name. I just didn't really think that his last name went with my first name, and I said as such to him. But I was adamant. I wanted us to have the same last name. I wanted us to be the last name, um, like as a family. And I wanted our children to have just one last. I didn't want a double barrel because his last name was really long, and double barrel in his last name with my last name just sounded ridiculous. But, um, we spoke about it at length and actually came to the. Well, he came to the decision because I said to him if he was really upset and didn't want to take my last name, then I would take his. But I didn't particularly want to. And he said after a while of deliberating about it that he did not care what his last name was. He had no attachment to his last name particularly, other than it was just what he knew. So we took my last name. We told everyone that needed to know. It was put on, um, at our Wedding on a balloon that my mum had got for us. And it was. Yeah, it was well known amongst our families that. That we were gonna be keeping my last name. And his mum didn't like it. His mum hated it, in fact, and even suggested. FYI, his mum and dad aren't married, so they have different last names. His last name is his dad's. Was his dad's last name, not his mum's. So his mum didn't even have the same last name as him and was horrified that we were gonna take mine. And I believe she probably still angry about it now. Um. And. And then even suggested that we take her last name, so we wouldn't have my last name or his last name, we would take her last name, which is not associated with either of us. And when I said no, that wasn't good enough either. And I'm. Last names can cause a lot of controversy.

7366015420479835434.voice_to_text: I had an ectopic pregnancy and I almost lost my life because of it I've never talked about this before so I'm gonna try to be authentic and maybe get some healing through this you get the shock of finding out that you're pregnant and then you go in for an ultrasound and they can't find the baby next thing you know you're getting multiple ultrasounds multiple doctors are coming in and the baby was in my right fallopian tube there are only two real options in this scenario you can remove the fetus from your fallopian tube or it can grow explode your fallopian tube and you can die I did have the fetus removed through a medicine called methotrexate which I believe they also give to cancer patients my medicine after a few weeks I was not feeling any better I was still having severe pain on my right side and decided to go back to the hospital I went back to the hospital and was seen by three different doctors and they almost sent me home thank goodness for the last doctor she walked in and inserted her fingers to check me out and immediately said we're going into surgery call who you need to call you a five minutes what happened was the fetus did not dissolve properly and left an infection in my right fallopian tube and they went in with a camera through my belly button to look at the fallopian tube and as soon as they poked my fallopian tube my fallopian tube exploded I'm not 100% sure of the details after this I was pretty loopy for the next few days but I now had an infection running through my body and they removed my right fallopian tube I don't think doctors were well informed on how to treat and manage an ectopic pregnancy when I had my follow up appointment the doctor told me that it would be nearly impossible for me to ever have my own children I also have a lovely reminder on my right side I have scar tissue about this thick and this wide to remind me every day of my ectopic pregnancy luckily I did have two beautiful healthy boys coming from my left side I personally am just a little disgusted when I hear 70 year old men talking about things that they don't understand I'm a little pissed at the doctors who didn't understand how to treat me either I still 12 years later carry around physical symptoms of my mistreatment

7365978325610810666.voice_to_text: GOD will literally test you by allowing something into your life that might look good but isn't actually from so a year ago I dated someone who seemed to offer everything I could ever want from a partner he was tall beautiful delicious and successful owning 23 apartment complexes in New York and he also had a provider mindset which was really important to me as I prefer to date or be with someone who lived a traditional life now there's a salient difference between a man who provides because he feels it's his job and a man who inherently has a provider mindset even if he's not financially well off I can extrapolate on that on a video if you guys are interested just let me know in the comments my heart couldn't fully open up to him despite his appealing qualities there were certain actions that made me believe there would be problems in the future and I couldn't love him the way I should love my husband I don't regret my decision to end the relationship and although he certainly looked good on paper I had to use my discernment and realize that he wasn't the person GOD had in store for me and I truly believe that by following my instincts I'm only getting closer to finding my true life partner and I can't wait to meet you where are you
