7365926022182702354.voice_to_text: hello I'm an academic of the Japanese language and culture and I'd just like to explain a few things first of all we're talking about  sanpaku not seppuku seppuku is the ritual  self-unbellying with a sword  in order to escape the enemy so that they don't defile your body while you're still alive those two are very very different things sanpaku refers to having white spaces around your eyes now for people who have a basic understanding of anatomy they might be wondering what  I'm talking about okay one eye white two eye whites basically so you're supposed to have two white spaces around your pupil right around your Iris and in Japanese culture sanpaku is when you have a third space whether above or below because that is supposed to be an indication that your time is near your time is near not your time is in the next 5 seconds okay I wanna be very clear about that and if you think about it logically in terms of historical development in terms of anatomy we can understand given the structure of Japanese eyes with the epicanthic fold here right that they don't have a lot of space around the eye that's white right there is usually not a lot of space that's because of the eyelid but as things happen as you grow old your body will start to wind down if you will now the way which humans wind down is pretty consistent so much so that we have medical techniques that can prolong life because we've already established the steps that tend to happen when a body is reaching its end point right so absolutely not in a spiritual sense in a very real physical anatomical sense the human body winds down in a very specific way okay and one of the ways which here I'm just going by my basic understanding of anatomy and and human existence um one of the ways is that your muscles start you know not really listening to you anymore the things that come with old age normally are tremors and also things like your skin just kind of sagging because the muscles underneath it are withering if you will now for those of us who don't have an epicanthic fold that will be most visible under your eyes right so if you have white space under your eyes you might wanna go and talk to somebody about it not in the oh my God I need to have a priest now but more in the sense of check that your blood level is fine check that you're getting enough vitamins check that I don't know whatever you need to check for your physical well being but I can say for a fact based on my lived experience and my observations of a lot of people who had space underneath their eyes and later expired yes there is a correlation  and it is not so immediate that you need to panic like the person is just going to poof the next moment because it's not like that and  if you think of JFK yes assassination happened but also the assassination wasn't a spur of the moment thing right so it was planned before he even  knew about it and as him being a new president he was already under a lot of stress and guess what stress can also have a very damaging effect on the body to the extent that it shows around your eyes and that's important to understand because otherwise you'll think that like somebody put a little X on his forehead and that's what made his eyes be weak you know weaker around here and that's what led to the thing and those two things are not connected right humans are able to establish patterns  cause they observe stuff right so for Japanese people it makes sense to notice when  people's eyes were a lot more exposed than usual normally for those of us who come from the side of the planet that isn't Asia in our case it tends to be called "sunken" and that's when you have like people  with my kind of eye shape and they end up like the the eye just looks like it's almost popping out because of how the the muscles are tightening around it because of the lack of support of the muscles underneath right technically the same thing but we have two different terms because how a white person will describe their physical well being is going to be slightly different because we have slightly different features and that's important to understand that Japanese people and the Japanese culture acknowledge that in the context of Japanese people and their physiognomy and their reality and their history and their culture it's still not a sign that immediately something bad is about to happen and I need to stress that because it is a really difficult thing when somebody is already facing  the end of their life they know this is the thing that living that that discrepancy that all people have described at different points in time that is a big sign that it's near but near doesn't have to mean like  two steps away could be a month it could be six months it could be another year in fact in that case I think it was at least three months so decouple the sanpaku from the immediacy of death from the um immediate connection to death because it's not like that it's more one more sign that if  you know how to read the human body will tell you that the  person's time is approaching that's it and it's not a bad thing and  it's not a good 7365457151579524360.video_description: #stitch with @Gracie  Storytime about driving in rural Australia - this is actually the weekend of my Churchill Fellowship! I was racing back to Brisbane in order to make the last possible interview time of the weekend and if I missed the interview, I was out of the running for the fellowship. I will say the panel loved my travel story and my 20 minute interview turned into a 45 minute chat (!!) including a performance of a solo work for saxophone to demonstrate what i was studying on my potential fellowship trip. Shoutout to my friend Chris who flew to Emerald just to drive/fly back to brisbane with me to help keep me on track. This was a crazy fun weekend and one of those stories you remember for a lifetime! #storytime #musicfestival #ruralaustralia #australiananimals

7365275067065929006.voice_to_text: I don't know if this will classify as the craziest thing that I've seen but it's one of the most memorable moments I've been in New York City for 10 years now and this is one of the top stories that I always tell people when they ask like oh what's the weirdest story that you can share about moving to New York I was on the L train going to go see my friend we were at 1st Avenue I'm by the door there's some people at the pole and someone gets on at 1st Avenue so from 1st Avenue to Bedford there's no stops just straight 2 3 minutes train is underwater you're not moving there's no stops in between there and so I'm standing there reading my Kindle like you know like a true New Yorker I'm reading my book there's people it's like the afternoon evening time it's a pretty crowded train the guy next to me is just I didn't even notice him didn't even pay attention to it but the people at the pole were just like looking in my direction and I'm like why are they like laughing snickering what's going on I happen to look to my right and the guy next to me took off his pants and in true New Yorker fashion I ignored it I was like no you came in here for attention I'm not gonna give it to you so I'm just gonna read my book so I continue to read my book we're still on that stretch between First Avenue Bedford and the people at the poll were just like they're pointing and snickering and just like comment like got more intense so I was like what are they doing I'm like what is happening I look over to my right again and I realised it's because this man had a makeshift thong he took like a white T-shirt look like he cut it up ripped it up whatever tied it on the side and made it into a makeshift thong and he's over here vibing right next to me with the door him and his reflection in the door were just in a moment together and I continue to stand there because I was like nope you are here for attention I'm not gonna give it to you I was here first you got on the train second I'm gonna read my book you will not get the attention that you're looking for from me you can get it from someone else and so I still stood there and you know acted like I didn't see him as uncomfortable as I was I was like you're not gonna get anything out of me not even a rise we got to Bedford because I was like ain't no way Imma finish going all the way to Bushwick standing next to this man so I switched to another train car but to this day I still wonder like what were you on and just buy a song I don't know whatever it's a lot ha ha but I still think about that story to this day and that's one of my top stories out of a couple of other ones that are kinda weird but that one that one takes the cake for sure

7365249921202572587.voice_to_text: Is people without a degree today. Because of this is so true. And I actually wanna share my story of this guy that I was dating fresh out of high school, who tried to get me to drop college. So let me set the scene. Um, I was freshly out of high school. I was in my first semester of college. At this time, I had no idea what I wanted to do. I just knew I wanted to obtain some sort of degree. And being a first generation South Sudanese, it was very important for me to finish school. So this guy I was dating was a bit older than me. Um, he had graduated probably years ago. I had no business dating him, but, hey, that was my past. So anytime I would go to school, or I would be, like, putting any sort of effort into studying, he would honestly be, like, upset. Like, why are you doing that? You don't need school. School is a waste of time. He told me I was gonna graduate with all this debt, and it's not worth it. So I remember he would even, like, go to the extent of being like, look, I can get you a job here. You would make this much money. You and I would put our income together, we'd make so much money together, you don't need school. Like, basically just trying everything to get me to drop school. I was really young and Naive, and, like, it was tempting, but honestly, the only thing that really stopped me from not dropping is my parents, because I was so afraid of them, and I don't know, like, what excuse I would even tell them if I did not finish school. I really, really liked him at the time, and I really wanted this relationship to work. So he basically kept putting in my face, like, it was either school or this relationship, and he kept making it seem like I was never going to get a boyfriend or date anybody ever again because I wanted to pursue a degree. I never understood why he hated school so much for somebody who didn't even attempt to go to college. But his excuse at the time is that he was ready to settle down and have children and basically all the things that, like, a lot of us young women want. Um, he said that he was willing and ready to provide for me, but he couldn't do that because I was gonna be focused on school and things like that. So anyways, a couple semesters later, I ended up making the decision that I wanted to go to nursing school, and I was going to, like, full blown focus on school at this time. You know, he was, like, super upset, and he ended up breaking things off with me, and he said that it was never gonna work. He told me I was going To be miserable. And he just didn't wanna be a part of it. I did end up going to nursing school. I end up graduating. And, y'all, all I have to say is, in 2024, Today, I am not the miserable one.

7365247937024199982.video_description: #stitch with @Pescatarian | DFW Food Creator Shout out to the woman who has always had my back: my mom. 🥹 Her honesty and support was what I truly needed to take my health seriously. And it worked! #storytime #weightloss #health #healthjourney #fyp
7365247937024199982.voice_to_text: the one moment that made y'all feel like hey I'm ready to start again serious about so for a little background I have always been a pretty decently sized girl and probably sounds weird but I'm 5 8 now and I have been 5 8 since I was about 12 years old and I was never like a string bean like I've had thighs I've had a butt I've always just been a very solid girl fast forward to about age 24 25 and my weight had just gotten out of control frankly I was in a really long term relationship where we enjoyed drinking beers together and going out and eating and I had a pretty sedentary life cause I was working in office job I was strictly wearing big t shirts and like a single pair of jeans that still fit me but I think I was in denial and just didn't really realise what I was seeing in the mirror Cue my mother and this is probably one of the best thing she's ever done for me but my mom just sat me down and you know asked me one day like when's the last time you weighed yourself and I honestly didn't have an answer because weighing yourself makes you feel bad and I don't think in that moment I was prepared to do that on my own so the next weekend my mom brought over the scale to my apartment and we weighed me and I was about 225 at 24 years old as a 5 foot 8 woman it's unhealthy just straight up that was unhealthy and the next day she helped me start Weight Watchers which was a mess if you sign up for Weight Watchers prepared to be hungry all the time because that was just the biggest side effect of it was that there wasn't enough food flash forward a couple months I believe it was around the start of covid so I was home all the time I actually had time and energy to put towards my health and that's when I started the carnivore diet I did carnivore for about four months eating strictly protein and fats no fruits no veggies no sugars no carbs and in a matter of a year or so I was down 50 pounds and feeling better and looking better than I had ever before so super low carb diet super high protein and consistently working out four to five times a week it just it completely changed my life it changed my mental health it changed my confidence everything so I appreciate the hell out of my mom for just being honest and real with me and I hope that others do that for you if you need it

7365220346825297183.video_description: #stitch with @KP I'm so happy this performance will never unalive. #fleetwoodmac #stevienicks #lindseybuckingham #la #405 #sandiego #oceanbeach #silverspring #tusk #uscmarchingband #storytime
7365220346825297183.voice_to_text: I was there. I was there. I was. I was in that studio when that happened. I was 22 years old, on the beach outside my house in Ocean Beach, San Diego, with my best friend and roommate at the time, Coley, who worked with me. And she nonchalantly says, last night at work, some guy gave me tickets to Fleetwood Mac. And I said, what? And she said, yeah, but it's tonight, and it's in LA, and I don't. I don't wanna drive. And I said, get the fuck up. Get up right now. Get up right now and get in my car. Now, LA is only about an hour away from San Diego, but that time of day on the 4:05 makes it about a three and a half hour drive. So we do not shower the beach off of us. We pretty much grabbed our shit and jumped in my car. And down the 4:05 we go. And I'm following Coley's directions, and all of a sudden, I'm on a studio lot, not a concert hall or an amphitheater on studio lot. And there are guards stopping us, asking us for things. And Coley leans over me and hands him this big Manila envelope. And he goes through that Manila envelope, finds what he's looking for, and he gives us directions to the studio that we are going into. Mm hmm. And when I get into that studio, I realize these are not concert goers. These are Very rich people in suits and ties. And here Coley and I are, 22 year old beach moms in t shirts over our bikini tops. Right about the time that I'm asking her if there's an opening band, gentleman comes out onto the stage and he's pointing to the lights and the signs overhead and telling us that these are the signs that will tell us when to clap. And they don't want anybody standing unless it's says that it's okay to stand. And I. I am very confused. And then. Then he says, this broadcast is about to be live over 300 countries. And I'm looking at Collie like, maybe we should award makeup. But then Fleetwood Mac started playing and I stopped being vain and I saw that performance, and it's stuck with me forever. And I'm really glad that it is getting a lot of traction here on TikTok lately. I will say that I did not hear for four days after. I could not hear anything for four days after that show, because. Tusk. When the USC marching band was coming down the aisle, that was painful. It was worth it, but it was painful. One more thing about that performance, you could see the spit coming out of Stevie Nicks mouth while she was singing. That reflected in the light while she was singing. Goose bumps. Goose bumps.

7365141448905280814.voice_to_text: Tell me a ghost story that sounds completely unbelievable but is entirely true. My house is super haunted. So I'm just gonna tell you a really short story that is always stuck with me. When I was a junior in high school, I woke up in the middle of the night in my bed, alone, to a voice telling me that I was the chosen one. Now, I never told anyone about that because it obviously sounds like sleep paralysis. Until a few years later, I'm catching up with a friend from high school. She tells me the story that one night, she had slept in my bed while I slept in the living room. And she had woken up in the middle of the night to a voice telling her that it had plans for her.

7365070273869139233.voice_to_text: if you haven't seen that video um it was on loose women I actually saw it through TikTok um about a mum saying she was disappointed that her daughter wasn't invited to the Year 11 prom and I don't know if it was because of attendance or behaviour or something I do not agree with this for one and I'm curious to see other people's opinions on it now little story time I when I was at school my school was part of a six form college and at the end of year 11 didn't get a prom because they encouraged everyone to go to six form where then school would throw the end of 6 form a prom now I wasn't going to sixth form I was going to college and I didn't think it was fair that people that weren't going to sixth form would miss out on a prom yes it's very Americanised and some people say like oh it's not even a British thing but it's still a really nice thing for year elevens to do to celebrate with their friends so the end of an era blah blah blah so I took it upon myself literally just me um to arrange a Year 11 prom my mum helped me obviously because I was only 15 um so I typed up a memo um put it in all the registers telling everybody that I was gonna be organising it and like details to follow I got pulled into the head teacher's office basically saying you're not allowed to do this without our permission blah blah blah and I said well it's something to do school like school are involved so they really made it awkward for me because they were like well you're sending out information on school property so I went ahead anyway I went and met with um what do you call it an event planner um at a big hotel it's called the Castle Green Hotel it's in Kendall um in the late district um met with them sorted all I arranged all the venue got photographer got DJ and arranged food worked out all the costs split it across everyone that wanted to come and I think a bar like five people the whole of Year 11 came people gave me money I gave them actual like got proper tickets printed um and it was like a full full event that I organised because school wasn't willing to do it and everyone came everyone had a great time school weren't happy about it because um obviously they didn't get their own way um but after that year so after my year of year 11 the school started doing proms so I'm just gonna take the credit for that one um but yeah I don't think it should be based on attendance I don't think it should be based on behaviour I think yes obviously like if you're looking for trouble just don't go but it's like a once in a lifetime thing kids are kids at the end of the day why are you gonna try and punish them for something that's fun this is why kids don't respect school because school treat kids like shit and not like human beings so yeah what's everyone else's opinion on the Loose Women video I'm interested to know

7365024710867963179.voice_to_text: normalize posting why you broke up on the internet so I have only ever been in two long term relationships my first boyfriend and my fiance and I will state for the record that you know my first boyfriend wasn't terrible like as far as first boyfriends go I definitely could have choose chosen worse it's late ignore me but the straw that broke the camel's back was pretty bad we started dating I believe my junior year of high school um you know he was my first kiss he took me to prom I was a year and a half older than him so I was only able to go to his junior prom but it was my senior year anyway also unrelated ignore the dents in my forehead I I get much more confident about them when I'm not staring at them in a screen it's from the Halo brace I had screws in my head anyway so it was my freshman year of college and my first semester I really wasn't able to come home much um I was going to college about an 11 hour drive on a good day from home but I was able to come home a lot more in the spring semester um and I was home for spring break and spring break that year was ending on Saint Patrick's Day now something some background um part of the reason why me and my ex boyfriend got together was we both were the gamers of our friend circles we met at youth group which I know but I digress we were the gamers and he really liked you know when we were together coming over to my house um he would play games on my dad's PlayStation I would sit next to him playing on my DS you know parallel play that honestly should have been a red flag for some of my ADHD but I digress um so he would that's frequently what our you know hangout days would consist of either me watching him play a game us playing a co op game or us playing two separate games like next to each other another important background fact is that my mum goes all out for holidays we're talking we have seven Christmas trees at Christmas one for every major room in the house like I have one in my bedroom that's all my ornaments we've got the main family tree there's one in the bathroom that's like a bunch of cat ornaments there's a story to that but so for Saint Patrick's Day my mom went all out with the you know the corned beef the cabbage fancy desserts I think like 14 layer jello all of it all of it and because the very next day my family was driving me back down to my college campus 11 hours away um I asked if my ex boyfriend could come over the last piece of context you need is that my dad's PlayStation is in the basement of our house and the basement is not typically heated there are no like vents for the furnace down there we do have a pellet stove but it only really like warms up the space if it's on for like a bit before you go down so I bring my ex over and he couldn't drive so I had to go pick him up and when we get back to the house my mom asks me if I can help her like with some meal prep and I say fine sure whatever and I hear my ex now ex boyfriend going down to the basement and I told him you know at least wait until after dinner to you know go and try to do video games because I knew him I knew that if he started playing a game it would be rough to get him upstairs to eat so he agrees but he's just like I don't know being a little weird about it a little Moody about it and I just I was a little frustrated but you know whatever it's what we typically did so it's it's whatever we have dinner I think it's great my dad decides he's going to put a fire in our fireplace in the living room and I am very vocal about how I like that because you know the reason he was doing it was because it was my last night home and my parents wanted to spend time with me while I'm helping my mom wash dishes I hear the boyfriend go downstairs without even saying hi to me as he passed me in the kitchen and turning on the PlayStation so I go downstairs and mind you once again the basement is unheated and this is you know Saint Patrick's Day in northern New England not I guess mid New England yeah not giving you guys my exact location regardless it's Saint Patrick's Day in New England it's chilly um so I go downstairs and I tell him I am not spending my last night at home in this unfinished basement when my parents are upstairs you can stay on the game or you can come spend time with me make your choice he doesn't even respond to me and I go upstairs the other thing is the game in particular he was playing on my dad's PlayStation was The Last of us and uh I have a very intense fear of zombies we're talking I tried to play the very first Resident Evil as a form of exposure therapy and by the time I finished fighting the first zombie in that game I was shaking so hard I had to turn it off so about 20 minutes later or so I get a text from the boyfriend's mother and she is she tells me oh me and my husband decided since you had my ex uh we're gonna have a date night we'll be there to pick him up in about 45 minutes to an hour I go downstairs again I tell him hey your mom just texted me she's gonna be here in you know between 45 minutes to an hour I'm not staying down here you know it's the game or me pick and again doesn't even look at me now the week I had come home uh me and my now ex went to GameStop together and uh I picked up a copy of Pokemon X and I was stuck on something in Pokemon X and he had beaten the game already um so I wanted to ask him a question but I was really annoyed at this point so I went downstairs uh I had my DS open and I was about to ask him my question but I decided to be a little petty first and I told him thanks for choosing the game over me babe I'm really feeling the love and he proceeded to look at me like I was the biggest idiot on the planet and say in this exact tone you do realize I'm addicted to this game right now right I didn't even end up asking him my question I just slammed my DS shut and went back upstairs so when his mom finally showed up to get him I called down from the top of my stairs your parents are here get out of my house now he had left his stuff in the living room where my parents were and I walked in there and basically said I don't even wanna look at him right now um I'll be out when he leaves and I went into my room I shut the door I sat against it so he couldn't open the door even if he did look for me and I'm sitting in my hear pretty much everything in my house from my room my dad had to pull the controller out of his hands when he went into the living room to get his stuff he didn't even ask where I was my mom told him that she was upset seeing me cry uh my last night home and his response was essentially good luck with that I think in the 20 minutes it took him to ride home in his car uh he realised that he messed up because then the love bombing started but I told him I was like I am not happy with you I am rethinking things this sucked and I need you to give me space technically we weren't officially are people are standing around and usually I think that the people that work at the grave site usually like wait like maybe an hour I mean I don't really know how it works but I thought that they wait men start to lower my grandfather into the ground um which turns out they had a lot of trouble doing so what they decided to do was they started jumping on the casket to try and get it into the ground no joke um it was it was so traumatizing like it's still stuck into my head this day um because you're warning someone obviously and then just to see like the grave workers like jumping on this casket 7364814224649964843.voice_to_text: so I was listening to a bunch of like those scary stories on my run hence why I'm a bit of a mess and I have some like really weird paranormal stories from when I was growing up but probably the most terrifying one was when I realized my imaginary friend wasn't an imaginary friend so up until the age of about six my family lived in a parsonage my father was a preacher at a local church um so we lived in the housing there and it was an older one story farmhouse and the basement was partially finished so my father had his office and then there was the spare bedroom and then the rest was just like open concrete and in that open concrete portion in like the back was like this really dark storage area and what I would do is I would come down the steps and run past it into the spare bedroom which also had a bunch of our toys in it well growing up while we were in the church and in this parsonage I had a friend I called Alice and she always appeared about 5 years old me 6 years old me and she had bright blonde curls and she wore this like blue older looking Lacey dress and I would play with her nearly every day while we were in the parsonage in the church and I tell my parents about these wonderful adventures that I had with Alice well when I was about 6 we moved away from the parsonage because we were focusing on my mom's career and dad didn't wanna travel with the church anymore so we moved to our um more permanent family residence where my parents still are today and there was a very quick shift in me playing with Alice every day to where I really didn't see her much and I would be playing in the new house either alone or with my sister and I would glance out the window and I would see her like in the street or on the edge of the property but she never came in and there would be days when I would like go down the steps and I would like go try to chase her and she just disappear and I would tell my parents about how upset I was that I couldn't play with Alice anymore and you know normal like sad kid things well time went on I kinda forgot about her to be honest I grew up I didn't need imaginary friend anymore now my youngest sister is 7 years younger than me and one day she was about 5 6 years old and I heard her playing in her room talking to someone and I was like oh she's just playing so I peek my head in and I'm like oh baby girl who you playing with and she smiles up at me she's like oh I'm playing with Alice which was like a total shock to me because I'm like oh that that's a little weird so I'm like oh what does Alice look like and she explained every detail of Alice it was kind of terrifying and I ran to my dad who at the time was being the stay at home parent and um it was summer time so he was home and I told him about this and it was just really freaky and he kind of brushed it off he was like well maybe we've talked about Alice in front of her before maybe she just like picked up on it no big deal I'm like you know what yeah you're probably right but this isn't a thing like she heard us talking about it it has to be that and I have note that like our family is kind of like weird when it comes to like the paranormal like I said I have a lot of like weird stories growing up for example when my great grandfather died he visit my grandma my dad and my middle sister in a dream that same night and they all cooperated what the dream was about so you know a little spooky but anyway so I grow up I leave for the military I don't see Alice again I don't really think about it much until one day we're like chilling um in the living room of our apartment and my husband goes um hey this is a really weird question but were you and sit home um around lunchtime and I said well no um I was at work she was at the sitter why and he said well I came home for lunch cause he worked at a gym right here on post and then our apartment was like right off post and he said there was a little girl in the kitchen in a blue dress and I'm like oh there was and again he described perfectly what Alice looked like now we're in our farmhouse right now completely different state from when I first saw Alice when my sister saw Alice and where my husband saw Alice and every once in a while I will just see out of the corner of my eye a blonde little girl in a blue dress and to keep my sanity I tell myself that it is my eldest daughter who has blonde hair and unfortunately I'm not gonna be able to pretend it for much longer because she's getting much too old to fit the description

7364796683575741739.video_description: #stitch with @TYJÚAN a poem breakdown of my poem “Taken Too Soon” a deeper dive into the story being told #poetry #storytime #spirituality #fyp #darkfantasy #spokenpoetry
7364796683575741739.voice_to_text: my Cambian took my soul so what story was being told let's talk about it so this poem is called Taken Too Soon and the first line is my Cambian took my soul and what I mean by that is Cambian is symbolism for the matrix the rat race your ego your shadow pain anger resentment like all those negative dark things that  you have to grow and learn from and so that's what Cambian is symbolism for and I feel like this poem is about your youth being taken from you um at a very early time in your life  I feel like  early on in my life I was forced to grow up pretty soon so that's what I mean by my Camion took my soul and there's a part in the poem where I talk about how I thrived in my youth and I was discovering my truth and I just feel like there was a time in my youth where I was exploring my creativity and my spiritual gifts with writing and you know I was just being adventurous and light hearted and having fun as a kid you know just being a kid but I think  that got taken from me very soon because I was forced to grow up growing up was really challenging for my family and I we had a lot of financial issues  moved around a lot had to adapt to a lot of different environments at a very young age and we were also trying really hard my siblings and I were trying really hard to stay strong for our mother who was a single mom raising the four of us and I think with all of that pressure and all of those things going on it took my childhood away and it forced me to grow up and I couldn't spend the time you know being creative and  exploring and being you know youthful I had to survive and you know my family and I have bonded and grown from that but at the time you know there was a lot of anger and resentment and in the poem I refer to the forest of umbra and umbra is Latin for dark and so the forest of umbra is symbolism of that same pain that anger that hatred that resentment for not having my youth  you know that was when I was feeling like you know oh if things went this way then I would have had this you know I would have been further ahead I would have had all these things like and you start kind of going back and forth in your head about what could have been and all these different things and there's a time though where like I saw a different perspective and now I understand that everything happens for a reason and although there is that sense of darkness with the idea of my youth being taken from me too soon but I feel like I've Learned so much and grown so much since then and I've been able to see the beauty of it all and I think that it's important to not allow your past to consume you and it's important to let go of those negative emotions and those negative feelings of holding onto something um that doesn't serve you and I think that that's where I realise that I need to let this go and use it as a you know as armour use it as a way to to move forward in a positive direction and I've realised that I've gained a lot of wisdom in this experience and it taught me to adapt really well so there are a lot of beautiful things that came out of this experience but overall this poem is really just about the darkness of your youth being taken so soon and I think that this could really help people out there that had a similar experience or are having a similar experience this is just to give you some words of wisdom that  this does not define you and your story and it doesn't halt anything it doesn't change your destiny it doesn't change your trajectory or your journey it just helps it you know progress and move forward um everything happens for a reason I do firmly believe that and if that is something that you've experienced in your life then it was for good reason so  this poem overall is you know just a story that I wanted to tell I think that all of my poems have that sort of sense of darkness and like fantasy and mythicality I guess is that a word I don't know but mystical energy is what I mean  I give all of them that because I feel like at a young age I love that kind of stuff like Harry Potter and you know I love fantasy films SCI fi films  that kind of thing and I wanted to incorporate that into my craft into my art now as a way to connect and nurture that inner child you know that young person who felt lost and scared and who couldn't explore their truths and their creativity you know cause it was taken from them too soon and you know I wanna channel that inner child and really incorporate into my art so it really does um explain you know my poetry and my writing and my songs and you know what I wanna do in the music industry but also what I wanna do in the entertainment industry and film I feel like all of my poetry will either come to life in a cinematic way or a musical way or something like that um but yeah it all comes from the heart it all comes from my inner child and just wanted to tell my story so thank you for listening and if you haven't heard the poem be sure to go check it out on the stitch and yeah thank you

7364670606102547755.voice_to_text: okay I have one and also excuse my appearance I just woke up from a really long nap um so just to preface this I was in my early 20s and at the time I was living with my ex um it was not a good environment we were fighting a lot um there was a ton of negative energy like it was not going well um to the point where I just was so I don't know it was just very very very upset all the time um I don't wanna go too much into it but um anyways um one night we were both asleep and we had the bedroom door open it was a tiny apartment um we had the bedroom door open and you see the stove and it had one of those like um can't think of the word right now but like the ventilation and then the little light under and I would keep that on because I had a lot of sticky shit happen in my life where like I have a ton of stories but um anyways I like to have it like a small light in the room and that was the perfect light it would you know cast some light into the room but not be too much um one night I'm sleeping we're both sleeping and I realise that like I'm looking towards the doorway and I see the light but then I see something else um I see a figure of a man it was unmistakingly a man and he it's just tall it's taking up the whole doorway and it's pitch black pitch black you can't even see through it and I can see that there's light you know on the other open parts of the frame but not through this figure um it was just darker than night and I got such an overwhelming fear like feeling of terror I don't know how to describe it it was so so scary and I could feel like just just evil that's the only way I can say just evil um and I couldn't move I realized I wanted to scream I wanted to shout I wanted to grab my ex at the time and shake him but I couldn't move and that scared me even more because like I never had sleep paralysis and I like I've heard about it obviously so I figured in that moment that's what it was but I was freaking out since I had never had it happen never had seen something like that um I felt things you know experience things but never had seen something like that um sorry for badly but um anyways I was fighting fighting fighting trying to move trying to scream trying to do anything finally after I started praying in my head I was able to move and in that moment that I moved moved um I woke up thing is when I woke up and I realized I had been actually sleeping I saw the figure in the doorway still and it like just slowly dissipated um scared the living crap out of me I had woken up my ex right away like told him like something was wrong forced him to believe me um but yeah I believe that those kind of entities or whatever are attracted by negativity because there was just so much negativity going on in the apartment at that time um it was attracted to that like not long after we broke up and whatever but never again have I experienced anything like that never again will I want to but yeah you have to be very careful because you can invite these things in simply by the energy that you put out um so yeah that's my story if you guys wanna hear any other stories um they're not as bad as that but yeah if you wanna hear any other stories let me know just thought I'd share

7364617469203336491.voice_to_text: so when I was about 10 years old I spent a lot of time with my grandma in the summer and she had rented out a house a very old house and she was living with my aunts cause they were teenagers my family's really young and I always got creeped out when I would go over there but this particular night I stayed up really late and I stayed up late a lot because whatever it's the summer and I was drawing and the TV was on now this space was an attic okay converted attic they turned into a room they push back a section of the attic okay and all of a sudden I'm laying there drawing minding my own damn business and boom boom boom boom all against the wall where the attic had been pushed back and then scratching and noises which one would say maybe animals and of course I'm sitting there frozen don't know what to do can't move I'm frozen what do I do what do I do where do I go I get enough courage to run downstairs go downstairs to the right where my grandma's room is supposed to be okay guess what nobody's there hmm so then I panic and I go back upstairs to my aunt's rooms and guess what nobody's there so I guess I have to go back into the haunted room I go back on into the room go under the covers and just please let me fall asleep get up the next morning go downstairs everyone's eating breakfast like everything's normal and I say where was everyone last night  I was really scared and I needed help and they're just looking at me like I'm crazy because they say what do you mean we were here this part of me thinks okay maybe they went out partying and didn't want to admit that they left me home alone but my grandma believed me because she could see in my face that I was terrified and that I was dead serious so she takes a crowbar and a hammer and she uplifts all of the paint from this little door okay she said well your dad's gonna be here in like 10 minutes though as she's like chiseling away at this door and my dad shows up and I gotta go he doesn't wanna wait for this to be revealed and then later I find out that she opened this door and in the corner in the corner all the way in the corner was a giant chest big enough to put a body but the house was so old there would not be enough support to go look at it so to this day nobody knows what's in that chest but honestly this is not the first time that this has happened to me I have a lot more stories like this but I've had so many realistic dreams that I had to get dream books and then decipher what is a message you know like ancestral messages from our DNA because I think that we when we sleep or the most vulnerable and not using a lot of energy for our physical body so it all goes to your brain and you're just going through all of these impulses and then I think we have chaotic dreams from stress that we pull imagery and people and phrases and things like that we bring them to try to formulate understanding of what we need to work on I think we have astral projection memories that we bring back when we're just buzzing around while we're our physical body is in laying form and then I think we have intervention dreams where other things come to us to try to talk to us but yeah I've had all of them I've seen a lot of stuff

7364615646073802030.voice_to_text: I've had a few experiences that are kind of questionable nothing that's so wild that are just like that's so unbelievable but I've experienced a few things this particular incident happened in like 2004 2005 when I was working at one of the local malls the Ontario Mills now this place is kind of known to give off weird vibes I think if you were ask  any former employee or even a current one they probably have a story to tell you I've read and heard a bunch of stories from different stores Dave and Busters has a bunch of wild stories that happened there I had a friend who worked at the opposite end of the mall the same time I was but Build a Bear and she has kind of a freaky story it's just this mall just gives off weird vibes customers would always say like there's a certain spot where you just like you feel instantly dizzy you feel nauseous you want faint it just your energy just kind of just changes once you're in there I was working at torrid at the time and this place wasn't too bad but you would get weird feelings from time to time you would often like I said it wasn't too bad there but you would get feelings of being watched all the time um I would see black figures from the corner of my eyes here and there uh I'll be closing closing up the cash registers and I would have my coworker at one end cleaning up and like I would be seeing other things on the other end from the corner of my eye um things would always fall off the shelves things were falling off the rack our back room was really awkward it was really long and narrow it was like this hallway and so all of the merchandise was up against this wall and we worked our way up so it had shelves racks you know garment bags things like that so in order to get through this back room you kind of brushed up all against this merchandise because it was just so narrow unless you're walking in sideways but you it was it was inevitable you would be touching all this stuff so you'd be at one end of the back room and you I'm looking for a product for a customer or whatever and you would hear these bags rustling like someone's walking through the hallway so I would automatically assume it was one of my co workers and would start talking to them be like hey by chance did you happen to see this product or that product haha I wouldn't get a response and I look and no one was there and I'm like hmm I'm just talking to myself let's go back to the feelings of being watched so our store at least didn't really have a ceiling I think for the most part a lot of the stores are the mall itself is like this there's no ceilings you see the AC ducts you see piping you see all that stuff and they would just be the roof of the actual building you'll get these feelings being watched from up above but you would look and there's nothing up there there's nothing to be hiding or anything cause it was all open unless it was so someone who's actually on the roof and there was times you would hear workers up there and you would hear the footsteps and things like that but you know that they're doing work up there I had a couple co workers who refused to use the restroom um with turning the lights on they would always use it in the dark because they would swear that they're being watched so it was a lot of small experiences like that until this one time uh we had four dressing rooms they were all locked all the associates who are scheduled would carry these keys that were on these like rubber spiral keychains that you carry on your wrist or your arm and we would have to unlock the doors for customers for them to try on the clothes it was common practice to knock on it before you know just be like make yourself kmown like hey is anybody in here you know I'm opening up just you know you never know cause even though these doors were closed and locked all the time if someone were to walk out after trying things on someone can slip in and you know with the door being open or whatever but like I said it was common common practice to knock on the door beforehand so I'm going to go unlock this door for a customer and I knock I do this the thing hey you know is anybody  here I go to pull the door open mind you these doors are big they're not like floor to ceiling doors are just like those typical dressing room doors but they're big and they're kind of heavy they're not on like tension springs or rods or anything like that so if you were to leave the doors as  it is they won't move they won't close they won't open they're just they're just doors on hinges and they're just that's all they were so I go to unlock the door for this customer and I pull it open and it rips from my hands and it slammed shut I immediately think there's someone in there I apologize I'm so sorry I didn't realize anyone was in there just probably didn't respond to me you know saying that I was gonna open the door whatever what it was they didn't say I'm sorry I opened the door again I didn't hear anything no one replied or anything the come customer and I kind of looked at each other and we're like okay there's maybe there's no one in there and I look kind of do the little under the under the door look and no one's there and we still kind of waited a little bit and I kind of peeked over the door no one was there so we open the door no one was in there there the dressing rooms were rooms there was no there were walls they couldn't slip under stalls or anything like that it was a wall so there could have been no one in there and so like the customer like so the customer myself just legit just like looked at each other like what because I'm so glad she was there because I would have felt like I was crazy because this door really was ripped from my hand to the point that that little spiral rubber keychain cause I had around my wrist was pulled off my wrist and it was still dangling in the in the keyhole and it was loud you would hear the door it was slammed shut and that it freaked me the fuck out and nothing ever like that happened again the other feelings were always still there but just incidents like that never happened again and oh my goodness it was it was freaky I've had other experiences just not at that mall um if you wanna hear those you let me know but they're not wild or maybe they are and I'm just trying to downplay them to not freak myself out I don't know

7364604026408717614.voice_to_text: oh my gosh 😍👻 I'm so excited!! okay so I'm so excited to tell my story I've waited like four days to hop on this trend and I'm like I'm in the dark in my apartment so it's even spookier disclaimer-this story did not technically happen to me it happened to a CNA I did like, a roleplay reenactment of this video I did mention it but um I'll just like tell my story I am a dropout nurse I used to take care of people with Alzheimer’s and Dementia the CNA were doing rounds and this young CNA girl ran into my room and was like totally petrified and there had been some shingle outbreak going on in the memory care unit and some people had been passing away 😔 I did know that someone next door had passed away and the CNA kept hearing The other living person the other living resident in that room next door to my patient she kept hearing her say um get out! 🫵 leave me alone 😡 get out of my room 🖕 so of course the CNA she was due to check up on that resident anyway👩‍⚕️ so she went and checked up on her and was like 🏃‍♀️ hey “Gladys” whatever her name was like hey Gladys you know what's going on She said tell my roommate “Martha” to get out of my room and the CNA is like you know Martha passed away from shingles last week you know you're here all alone and she said no we're not I'm getting chills and she said no we're not Martha's behind us she's in my closet she's staring at you UGH creepy! like I'm getting I'm getting chills right now so um I'm in the dark in my apartment I'm gonna shit myself The CNA completely freaked out did not turn around to look inside that closet and ran into my room Where I was with my client was so scared

7364602228612680991.voice_to_text: one way to get over a mustache man is to ask yourself would he sail a thousand ships for you but my mustache man he couldn't even sail one boat for me  he got this boat and we were gonna live on it we were gonna be boat homeless cause i was pretty out of options at that point but he told me he could sail he seemed really confident I was convinced I thought it was gonna be fine I thought we were gonna go places and see things we weren't gonna be homeless we were gonna be ✨nomads✨ no and at one point the boat had to be moved cause it was too expensive where it was we need to move somewhere cheaper and shittier and him and his two buddies who all worked on a sailboat for a living got on this sailboat and couldn't sail it we got like underway for an hour and a half two hours and then the motor fell off and the wind died and they called the tow boat for the sailboat I have this unexplainable weakness for curly moustache men and it has led me wrong every single time learn from my mistakes

7364601701380443438.voice_to_text: hello story time again well this happened when I was 14 years old me and a good friend of mine we're in my room and we were going to play with a Ouija board that I had just got so we wanted to try to talk to our dead relatives I got my dad's hard hat and she got her grandmother's glasses and we commenced to playing with the Ouija board and for one thing the wind started to blow and we had the doors closed and a window was down and the candle was flickering that was weird at first and then it started moving and it said on it um spell out the words my friend's name was Debbie and I said Debbie don't hang with Missy anymore that's my name Missy um because she's a witch and it's inherited and then we asked it who was saying this to us and it spelled out Satan and we both started screaming and yelling it was very scary and you know I I think about it never say goodbye to it for one thing oh yeah in the basement the basement stairs right next to my room and we heard footsteps and there was nobody down there so it was really scary situation and from that day to this day I have never played with one again I never let my kids play with one I'm not gonna let my grandkids play with one you don't know what you're inviting into your life when you play with a Ouija board so don't do it just praise the Lord that's all you need to do you don't need to talk to no dead people cause you can't do that anyways and you're gonna you're gonna conjure up something evil okay god bless everyone and thank you for listening bye bye

7364586598312365358.voice_to_text: if you want to sick new world please let me know how it was where do I start hot crowded windy overwhelming scary overpriced so I went to when we were young two years ago and I already knew that the venue choice for music festivals is not good it's way too small now here's the thing if you sold an appropriate amount of tickets then the venue would be great but they completely oversell these events especially this year's Sydney World now I bought the cheapest possible ticket tier 1 of general admission 3:50 I don't know if that was with or without tax buy or and fees but that's kind of what I remember I also had to buy a Vegas hotel and then here's where it gets tricky so there's no parking at the festival so you have to take the monorail which when I went to when we were young in 2022 nobody really knew what this event was how to get there how to do it so the monorail was great but this year since they pumped it down everyone's throat on social media everyone did it and I went there I left my hotel at 7:30 I got to the line at 8:30 the doors didn't even open until right before 11 the gates now here's the thing I already knew that this event was disorganized because when we get there security guards are having meetings the people in the yellow vests the workers that are giving out alcohol risk bands that are letting people through the line they don't even know they're asking their manager what to do their managers telling them which wrist to put these alcohol bands on like they came completely unprepared that's the first thing second thing is there wasn't even enough security for how many people were let into this festival so that being said once you're inside they crammed so many bands in the lineup I mean bands were performing for like 20 30 minutes only a few bands got over hour sets but regardless for such a small venue it took forever to walk between bands and between sets between stages because it was way overcrowded way overcrowded I mean I just couldn't believe it and I'm like okay so I'm paying this much money and all I'm doing is being shoved in a crowd and like what if there's some type of emergency how am I supposed to get out also it was really hot and it felt really crowded that's kind of it is what it is Vegas we're in the desert and it's we was windy too at first which was kinda nuts my outfit was going wack but in general it just felt very disorganized also a lot of the stages especially the spiral stage kept having sound issues the mic kept going out I mean come on be prepared for these bands and yeah that's my opinion I loved every year like for Sick New World for when we were young they have a great light up they get really good bands for these festivals it's just the way it's organized and the venue choice I do not love um I had to leave Sleep Token and to smoke down early which are the main bands I wanted to see because I didn't wanna wait hours on to get on the monorail because this is at the very end of the strip just it was nuts it was just nuts I can't imagine like I feel like I waited more in lines and with people that actually seeing music so that's it honestly the bands made it worth the experience for me but the organization is really disappointing for how much money that we're paying like bring back World Tour

7364531188301679914.voice_to_text: Tell me a ghost story that sounds completely unbelievable, but it's entirely true. So my mom went to college in Florida, and one of the years that she was in college, she was actually, like, renting a room out of this person's apartment. So she said one night she woke up in the middle of the night, and she kind of turned over, and she noticed that there were two people standing at the edge of her bed. She said it was a man and a woman. They didn't say anything. They just stare directly at her, motionless. She said that they seem to be wearing, like, you know, colonial garb. Like, definitely, like, old timey spirits, basically. So this absolutely freaks her out. She's frozen in fear. She doesn't know what to do. And so she says that she finally kind of, like, gathers enough courage to, like, throw the covers over her head and try to fall asleep. She says she does eventually fall asleep. Wakes up in the morning, everything's fine. Second night in a row, she gets woken up to the colonial couple standing at the end of her bed. Once again, they just stare at her. Like, they don't say anything, they don't do anything. They are just standing at the end of her bed, staring. So once again, she finally gathers enough courage to, like, grab the blankets, put it over her head, and she eventually falls asleep. Now, this is where the story Takes a bit of a switch. The third night rolls around, and my mom is exhausted. Not only is she in college working a bunch of jobs, she has now been woken up two times in a row by this colonial couple. Who will not let her get her beauty rest. So she said this time she was over it. Third night rolls around. Once again she is woken up to the colonial couple standing at the end of her bed. And this night she was over it. She looked them dead in their ghoulish eyes and said, leave me the f alone. And they disappeared. And she never saw them again.

far away from a shark mentality  I'm pretty much a recovering people pleaser but after doing quite a bit of shadow work I now realised that yes there is definitely a shark inside of me so hold on to your seats because that is a pretty fucked up story so I was seven or eight years old in a small village in France going to school and in my school there were a littlegirl I didn't like honestly I don't know why I think she was making fun of me or maybe she was just annoying I don't know  and so one day during recess I asked that one little boy who was deeply in love with me and he had you know that type of behaviour where he would seem very desperate he would always want to kiss me or hold my hand and he was just very needy and so I thought that's pretty annoying too so I decided to kill two birds with one stone and that's when my 7 year old self had her first machiavelic plan so I asked this little boy to go kick that little girl I didn't like  In exchange of a kiss so the little boy did it without any hesitation and he kicked that little girl straight in the butt and she started crying and so the teachers saw him and punished him he had to spend the rest of recess in a corner punished and that little girl was crying probably pretty confused to why that just happened to her and I just stayed away from all of this trying to realise what just happened and I just remembered that at the end of recess when the little boy came to me to be claiming his kiss I told him no because he had been punished and the promise of a kiss was only valid during recess I had totally made up that last rule I didn't want to go with it so I just didn't kiss him and that was the end of my real Machiavelic plan but thankfully I realised that this was bad I went home and remembered that girl crying and that little boy being punished and I thought whoa that is fucked up  so I decided on that day to not do that again but I did realise that I had a lot of manipulative power and so I could have easily choose to use that manipulative power to my advantage and keep on using people and manipulating them to get what I want but thankfully I chose not to and you know we all have that good wolf and bad wolf inside of us and I think that's when I really realised that yes I definitely had a bad wolf inside of me too but so yeah at 7 or 8 years old I definitely had a shark mentality and I definitely could have turn into someone who was very much not a good person so realise what you are capable of and choose to act in the best interest of the people around you and not only your best interest that's what it means to be a good person but do not be afraid to realise that yes we are all capable of terrible things

7364406628969385258.voice_to_text: my soul was bound to chains so what story was being told let's talk about it so this poem is called Shadow Cry and this is a really dark poem it's really heavy poem I think this was a poem that I wrote about a very early time in my life where I was exploring and experiencing the heaviness that I like I was processing the heaviness that I've always felt at a young age and I think that there was a time in my life where I realised that I had always felt so hidden I always felt like there was this weight on my shoulders and I felt like I couldn't be who I truly was meant to be  there was a part of me that just kept shrinking myself and trying to hide who I truly was and I feel like this poem is really about feeling locked away almost in a tower and no matter how loud you scream no matter how hard you try to get out no one's coming to help you and no one can hear you and you're just stuck you know and that's what I felt like for a big um you know long time and this poem is about really breaking free from that and I think it's about breaking those generational curses it's about unlearning all of those things that you grew up learning about yourself and like who you should be and those people pleasing tendencies and that's what it was about for me with this poem  you know just really trying so hard to be something just to feel loved and the truth is is that never works you it's so important for you to learn to love yourself and all the differences that you have it's important to embrace your uniqueness your eccentricity all those things are so important to embrace because they are what make you you and you are given those gifts for a reason so that's what this poem is about it's about shattering the societal standards about shattering the manipulation it's about breaking free from the matrix and it's about claiming your power and owning everything that you're meant to be and who you are and you know there was a lot of times within this darkness that I was experiencing that I felt like leaving and I want to just say like for anybody out there that is feeling this heaviness on their shoulders and feeling like it's hard to embrace who you are um just know that it takes time but do not give up on yourself you owe it to yourself to take a step forward every single day even if you take 10 steps back like no matter what always aim to take a step forward and you will discover your truths and you will learn to embrace them and this journey will get easier and that's what this poem is all about um I call it Shadow Cry because your shadow is your ego your shadow is all the darkness that you experience in your life and some of us stay in our shadow and some of us kill our shadow off and move forward into light and I want this poem to be about moving forward into light and I didn't get saved those chains that impede me became the chains that freed me and what that means is I had to figure out why the chains were on to be able to take them off and that is what I did I basically just processed my past and decided to move forward and I decided to wear my chains as armour and not allow myself to be bound to those chains as a victim you know it's important to keep your head up and to stay strong and to move forward in power and that is the overall lesson that I took with me in this dark experience so I hope you enjoyed the poem if you haven't checked it out be sure to and thanks for listening

um they were very different experiences I can tell you that but I will say I moved in with them each around the same amount of time so first relationship I was barely out of college I didn't really know what my future was going to be but the biggest thing in my mind was I was living with my parents and I wanted out I wanted my independence I did not wanna live with my parents anymore I was like I have my degree see you goodbye like how can I get out I feel like most people kinda go through that experience and I had a boyfriend at the time and to be honest our relationship was not that great and I think deep down I knew it wasn't that great and self esteem wise I think it's what I thought I deserved and so I didn't really question all the red flags I didn't really question how he treated me I just kind of went along with it even though we had almost broken up couple times had some big fights and stuff I think two things us moving in together under a year was so I could get out of my parents house and it was also in a way I think we were trying to save our relationship by being closer which is silly and never really works out fast forward a couple years later obviously that guy and I broke up it was just bad um I didn't have a financial means to get out of that situation he was fine for the most part but we did have to live together for a few months after we broke up and that was just horribly awkward that was just not fun um but we made it the best we could have made it given the circumstances I then moved out with a roommate I met online live with them for a year and started dating my boyfriend that I'm with now and after you know while dating the question came up you know when did we wanna move in together and it just became really clear that this relationship was different this relationship was very healthy and we just get along really really well and we have a lot more ties in our communities like we're from the same hometown mutual friends just you know care about each other do more things outside the house together more shared hobbies I just felt really happy in this relationship and it just kinda worked out where we were talking about living situations and we really just wanted to live together I mean we had opportunities to renew our lease or you know find our own places but it just was like well we wanna live together and we wanna explore life together so let's just do that and that was also a little under a year but we're really happy we live together we love our place he's amazing I mean I have been finishing grad school and he's been my biggest supporter he totally helps out around the house I've honestly been kind of slacking on household stuff and he's been a super big help and it's great and I've never felt more at home and at peace than living with him and so to me it's not about you have to wait three years you have to wait four years it's just asking yourself do you feel that this is a healthy relationship that you want to see grow do you want to be around this person more do you want to truly test the relationship if you're thinking about eventually getting married or having a more long term situation is this someone that you want to combine your life with and if the answer is no or you have some doubts don't freaking move in with them but if the answer is yes just look at your situation could you get out of it if it doesn't work out financially don't allow yourself to get stuck and for the most part if you feel in your gut that it's what you want I say go for it

7364154526451928363.voice_to_text: I saw a bunch of people stitching this person's video right here and I thought I wanted to share my experience because before the situation happened to me I did not believe in ghosts I did not believe in spirits I didn't believe anything of the nature however this situation changed my outlook on that specifically I was in Arkansas at the time shooting an engagement session I just really booked this gorgeous Airbnb that was built in the 1800s but when I got there night I was like super happy with how the inside looked because I was gonna do some of the engagement photo shoot in that building but when I got there it was like kind of creepy feeling as soon as I open the door but I turned all the lights on and kind of like ignored like that sense of something's off here that I kinda had in my gut so I decided to take a shower and like kinda like freshen myself up after feeling just like grummy after traveling and what not I went to get in the shower and as I started washing out the soap suds from my hair shampoo I literally felt this like dark presence kind of like pass through me felt like very like a very tall presence super weird the shower broke like it was this beautiful claw foot tub the the plumbing completely broke and water was spraying everywhere totally freaked me out I just felt super weird about it I went and put my pajamas on and I sat in the master bedroom of the house which I was on the second floor by the way the Airbnb was on the second floor left all the lights on and I called my best friend because I knew that she was from Arkansas and I was like I would love to fly you out here cause I can't stay in this haunted place myself would you please like come and stay with me so I literally flew her out the next day and she came to Arkansas to be with me in this Airbnb because I wouldn't have gotten a refund and I had paid like 15 hundred dollars for like a couple of days to stay in this place we ended up not staying we ended up in a hotel leaving I just said screw it and I missed out on money because like even when she was there like she totally felt the same presence that I did and I ended up finding out that the house was previously owned by a slave owner so that was probably him and that presence that we were sensing but like I might have to try to find some photos but there was like these really creepy mouse caricatures that were in these photo frames on the wall if anybody was following me at that time you might remember this is in 2,020 anyway so this is my my experience my ghost experience ever since I've been like very kind of in tune with energies and stuff and what not and I used to never ever think that that was even a thing or believe in ghosts period but now I do so that's like my own little story I guess that I have and why I definitely believe in the paranormal because I experienced it

7364065247637884202.video_description: #stitch with @seanlans why are salaries so low? How do we fix it? - - @Madeline Pendleton #storytime #salary #capitalism #minimumwage #anticapitalism #economy #inflation
7364065247637884202.voice_to_text: salaries I've been seeing for certain jobs I am shocked with how low they've gotten tell me if this has ever happened to you you work in a job maybe at a small business maybe at a corporation where you are a lower paid employee or at least there's a big gap between what you make and what the people at the top of the company and you go to your boss and you ask them what can I do to earn more money or maybe you talk to the owner directly somebody who's making hundreds of thousands of dollars more than you and you ask them what can I do to make the amount of money you are making and they don't have a satisfactory answer for you like maybe they tell you well you can you can do these things you can work for commission but it all requires some kind of trade off and ultimately the answer frankly is there's nothing you can do to make as much money as me this is not a new conversation but in this age of TikTok we're all connected we're all sharing more information not only in our own companies has it become invogue to talk about how much money we're making it's become easier to tell how much money the business you work for is making how much money the owners are making and inflation is going up the cost of living is increasing our salaries aren't keeping up it's it's not news it's not new but there are some things I think bosses and owners particularly should be thinking about and that employees can also think about that can help us address this problem I wanna tell you a story about it to illustrate what I mean I used to work for a small sales oriented business there were 10 employees and the owner made several times more than the lowest paid employee lowest paid employee might have made like 45 thousand dollars and the owner in a good year would make between 250 and 500 thousand dollar the highest paid employee made less than $100,000 and they had some other incentives like uh small percentage of the profits are shared with all employees and they have 4 O 1K match and vacation days and stuff like that but the incentives were not aligned and to be fair the owner took a disproportionate share of the risk like if we had a hundred thousand dollar order and something went wrong and we decided as a business we needed to eat the cost of it that ultimately came out of the owner's pocket but this company had such a high rate of churn we were always hiring people because people were always leaving the company like if we hired someone it was far less likely they were gonna last a year than that they would last a year or more not only this but engagement was super low like these are salary employees but the owner was constantly struggling and asking me you know I I feel like nobody is as invested in this as I am I say that it's a busy week but people are coming in late or they're taking long lunches or they're leaving early what can I do to fix this person felt like the salaries alone were fair compensation but what I wanna say to them and what I wanna say to any owner of a business is I don't think it's fair at all and to solve this problem you have to do a better job of aligning your employees incentives and your incentives so that they are more there's an account right here on TikTok Madeline Pendleton is the creator she runs a business where all the employees including herself the owner are paid the same based salary I think it's like $75,000 and I think they adjust this regularly to keep up with costs of living but what this does is first of all it says in a powerful way more than words could do we me the owner and you the employee are just as important to the success of this business not only that but they also have an unlimited time off policy a policy that more than words can do puts people over profit and some owners maybe like the boss at my last company would say this is not fair I take a disproportionate share of the risk and therefore I'm entitled to moral of the reward or uh why would anyone start a business in a context where they're not gonna earn as much but here's the kicker this business is not only quite profitable but the employees are more committed they stay longer and so the overhead cost the cost related to churn go way down this business though it doesn't pay the owner as much on a salary line is far more profitable far more scalable far more sustainable than a business where the incentives are not aligned where there is a big gap between the earners and there is an opportunity for dissatisfaction disengagement to be cultivate in the age of information in the age where people are upset about what's going on in the economy we're absolutely gonna need solutions like this that can help us increase salaries keep up with the cost of living and find more satisfaction in our job if you've got other examples of this kind of thing if you have questions about this leave them in the comments I look forward to continuing the discussion
